content:
しぎ〔仕儀〕
〈名〉A case; circumstances

content.content: こういう仕儀ですからなにとぞお待ちを願います
Such being the case,―Under these circumstances,―I must request you to wait.
月払いもできない仕儀です
I am in circumstances not admitting of monthly payment―I can not pay my monthly bills.
退くに退かれぬ仕儀になった
I am in for it.

しぎ〔私議〕
〈名〉
1. (=私見)one's personal views; one's private opinion
2. (=陰口)backbiting:(=する) to speak ill of (one) behind one's back

content:
しぎ〔鴫〕
〈名〉The snipe; the sandpiper; the curlew

content.content: 心無き身にも
Even to the ascetic pale
哀れに思うかな
It is a pensive sight―
鴫立つ沢の
The autumn's even of the dale
秋の夕暮れ
Whence curlews take their flight.

content:
じき〔時期〕
〈名〉Season; time; the times

content.content: 今は花の時期だ
It is the cherry-blossom season.
この花は時期外れだ
The flower is out of season.
この事業には時期が好い(悪い)
The times are favourable (unfavourable) to the enterprise.
時期未だ早し
It is too early―premature.
講和を論ずるには時期尚早し
It is premature to talk of peace.
時期が後れた
It is too late.
時期未だ熟さず
The time is not yet ripe.
時期の熟すを待つ
to wait for the time to come―bide one's time
時期を待って教えてあげよう
You shall know it all in good time.

content:
じき〔時機〕
〈名〉An opportunity; a chance; an occasion; time

content.content: 時機を待つ
to wait for an opportunity―watch for a chance―bide one's time
時機を待つよりほかはない
There is nothing for it but to wait.
時機を見て意見をしてみよう
I will take occasion to talk to him.
時機に乗ずる
to seize the opportunity―seize the moment
時機を逸する
to miss the opportunity―let slip the opportunity―lose one's chance
彼はのろまでいつも時機を逸する
His slowness always loses him his chance.
時機を逸するな
Take time by the forelock!
この時機を逸すべからず
Now (is the time,) or never!
時機よろしきを得る、時機に投ずる
to be opportune―seasonable―timely―well-timed
時機に投じたる策と言うべし
It must be pronounced an opportune scheme―a timely project.
事件の発表は時機を得た
The publication of the affair was well-timed.
時機に適せず
to be inopportune―unseasonable―untimely―mistimed
今干渉しては時機を得ない
An interference would now be unseasonable―untimely―mistimed.

content:
〈副〉
1. (=に)(=間も無く)soon; presently; in a minute

content.content: 彼はじきに来る
He will be here very soon―presently.
じきに用意ができます
I shall be ready in a minute.
もうじきに寒に入る
The cold weather will soon set in.
じきに帰る
I shall not be long.
じきに行ってじきに帰る
I shall be there in a trice, and be back in a jiffy.

content: 2. (=早く、容易に)quickly; easily

content.content: この子はじきに覚える
The child learns quickly―The child is quick at learning.
ガラスはじきにこわれる
Glass vessels break easily―Glass vessels are apt to break.

content: 〈副詞、前置詞相当〉(=じき近く)near by, close by, hard by, just by (a place); close upon, nigh upon (the time)

content.content: 学校はここからじきだ
The school is near by―close by―only a little way from here―only a step from here.
学校までじきだ
It is only a little way to the school―only a step to the school.
そこは学校からじきだ
It is only a little way from the school―only a step from the school―near by the school―close by the school.
学校はもうじきだ
The school is near at hand.
学校のじき近くに宿を決めた
I have taken up my quarters near by the school―close by the school.
僕の所は学校へじきで五分かからない
I live within five minutes' walk of the school.
その家はじき向こうだ
The house is right opposite ours.
医者の家はじきこの横町だ
The doctor lives just round the corner.
その人の家はじき隣だ
He lives next-door to our house―He is our next-door neighbour.
もうじき十二時だ
It is nigh upon twelve―on the stroke of twelve.
彼はもうじき四十だ
He is close upon forty.
試験はもうじきだ
The examination is close at hand.

content: 〈接続詞〉(=否や)as soon as; the moment

content.content: 彼は酔うとじき怒り出す
He gets angry as soon as he gets drunk.
僕の姿を見るとじきにコソコソと逃げ出した
He slunk off the moment he saw me.

It is opportune―seasonable―timely―well-timed―pertinent to the occasion.

content:

content:

〈名〉
1. (=試業)an examination; an exam:(=する) to examine (one in English, etc.)

content.content: 英語を試験する
to examine one in English
英語の試験
an examination in English
数学の試験がありますか
Shall I be examined in mathematics?
英語と数学の試験があります
You will be examined in English and mathematics.
何々試験されたか
What (subjects) were you examined in?
試験科目
subjects for examination
入学試験科目は左の如し
The applicants for entrance will be examined in the following subjects:―
試験が厳しい
The examination is rigorous.
試験を行う
to hold an examination
四月一日より試験を行う
The examination will be held from the 1st of April.
試験はいつあるか
When is the examination to be held?―When is the examination to take place?
試験を受ける
to take an examination―sit for an examination―go in for an examination
君は試験を受けるつもりか
Are you going in for the examination?
弁護士は試験を受けなければならぬ
A lawyer must pass an examination.
試験に出る
to go up for the examination―appear at the examination
彼は試験の時に病気になった
He fell ill at the examination.
試験を経る、試験を済ます
to go through an examination
試験は形式だけにするのだ(から心配することはないなど)
The examination is gone through for form's sake.
試験が切迫した
The examination is close at hand.
試験が近くなったので生徒が勉強し出した
The students are working hard at the approach of the examinations.
試験が心配だ
I look forward to my examination with apprehensions.
試験の準備をする
to prepare oneself for an examination―read up for an examination―mug up for an examination
彼は試験準備に忙しい
He is busy preparing himself for the examination.
試験勉強する
to study up for an examination―cram for an examination
試験勉強
cramming
君のは試験勉強だ
You are a crammer―an examination grinder.
試験準備に地理や歴史をにわか仕込みする
to cram up―get up―history or geography for the examination
家庭教師が試験準備をして助ける
A tutor coaches a student for the examination.
試験準備教育
coaching
試験に及第する
to pass the examination
試験に落第する
to fail in the examination―get plucked
試験の上入学を許す
The applicants are admitted on examination―admitted by examination.
中学卒業生は無試験入学を許す
Those who have finished the middle school are admitted free of examination.
無試験入学
admission free of examination
試験の監督をする
to watch over the students at an examination―invigilate
試験の監督
invigilation
試験が済んだ
The examination is over―The examination is at an end.
試験の成績

試験の成績が早く聞きたい
I am anxious to know the result of my examination.
試験の成績はいつ発表になりますか

試験の成績は官報で発表になる
The results of the examination will be published in the Official Gazette.
試験問題

試験問題を出す

What sort of a paper was set you at the examination?
試験問題を残らず答える
to floor the paper
試験の答案
one's examination-paper
試験の答案を出す
to give in ［hand in, send in］ one's paper
試験に白紙を出す
to give in a blank paper

the examiners
試験官
an examiner
試験場
the examination-room
試験料

試験制度

入学試験
the entrance examination
学年試験
the final examination
学期試験
a terminal examination
臨時試験
a special examination
再試験
a re-examination
口頭試験
an oral examination
筆記試験
a written examination
競争試験
a competitive examination
教員検定試験
the examination for the teacher's licence
文官登用試験
the civil service examination
外交官試験
the examination for diplomatic service
判検事登用試験
the judicial service examination
医術開業試験

弁護士試験
the lawyer's examination―the examination for the bar

模擬試験

content: 2. (=実験)an experiment; a test; a trial:(=する) to experiment on (a substance); to make an experiment; to test (the strength); to put (one's character) to the test; to put (one's virtue) to the touch; to try (a gun); to make a trial

content.content: 新発明の元素を試験する

to put one's character to the test―put one's character to the touch―take one's measure

I will put him to a character test.

試験に堪える

〈副〉Very; most; extremely; in the extreme

content.content: 至極よろしい
Very good!
仰せ至極ごもっとも
You have very good reason to say so.

content:

〈名〉Time

content.content: もう寝る時刻だ
It is time to go to bed.
約束の時刻までに行かにゃならぬ
I must be there by the appointed time.
時刻を計って何かする
to time anything
彼は時刻を計って来た
He timed his appearance.

content.content: 自国語
one's mother tongue―the vernacular
彼は自国語のように英語を話す
He speaks English like one to the manner born.
自国語を犠牲にして英語を研究した
I have studied English at the expense of my Japanese.
自国製の品
home-made articles

〈名〉Hell; the Hades; the inferno; the infernal regions; the nether world; the bottomless pit

content.content: 聞いて極楽見て地獄
It is a Paradise to hear of, a Hell to see.
この世からなる地獄
It is a Hell on earth.
地獄に落ちる
to go to Hell―be damned―be lost
地獄へ落ちた霊魂
a lost soul
生きながら地獄へ落ちる
to go down quick into Hell
地獄で仏に逢ったよう
I found “a friend in need.”
地獄の沙汰も金次第
“Money opens all doors.”
板子一枚下地獄
to have only one inch of plank between one and death
船乗りは
The sailor has
板子一枚
A single shell
下地獄
'Twixt him and Hell.

transit

content:
しごと〔仕事〕
〈名〉Work; a task; a job; employment; occupation; business; pursuits

content.content: 仕事をする
to work―do one's work
職人は仕事をしている
The men are at work.
仕事をしながら話しをしている
They are talking at their work―over their work.
仕事をしなけりゃならぬ
I must do my work―attend to my business.
彼はまじめに仕事をする
He goes about his work in earnest.
今日は好い仕事をした
I have done a good day's work.
彼は今日は少しも仕事をしない
He has not done a stroke of work today.
仕事に不熱心だ
He has no heart for his work.
仕事に熱心だ
He puts his heart into his work―His heart is in his work.
君はどこの仕事をしているか
Whom do you work for?
ある会社の仕事をしている
I work for a certain firm.
君は仕事があるか
Have you any work to do?
仕事が忙しい
I am busy with my work.
やりきれないほど仕事がある
I have more work than I can do.
今日は仕事がある
I have some business to attend to―something to do―today.
仕事が無い
I have no business to attend to―nothing to do.
彼は仕事が無くて遊んでいる
He is out of work―out of employment.
仕事が無くて困っている
He is badly off from want of employment.
彼はきまった仕事が無い
He has no regular occupation―He is at a loose end.
何か仕事がありませんか
Can you find me some employment?
彼は仕事を捜している
He seeks for employment―He is looking out for a job.
仕事を見つけた
He has obtained employment―secured employment.
あれは仕事のできる男だ
He is fit for work―an able man.
いま一人の方は仕事ができない
The other man is unfit for work.
僕は朝が一番に仕事ができる
I do my best work in the morning.
仕事を始めよう
Let us begin work!―fall to work!
もう仕事を止めてもよろしい時間だ
It is time to leave off work.
気に入らないから仕事を止めた
I have given up my work, for it was not to my taste.
仕事を仕上げる
to finish one's work―get through with one's task
今日の仕事が済んだ
I have finished my day's work―(は英、米は)―I am through (with my work) for today.
彼はいつも仕事が遅れる
He is always behindhand with his work.
仕事を急いでやって下さい
Please make haste with your work!
彼は仕事が早い
He is quick with his work―a quick hand―a fast worker.
仕事が遅い
He is slow with his work―a slow worker―a slow hand.
仕事に追われる
to be driven by business―pressed by business
仕事を追うとも仕事に追われるな
“Drive thy business, let not they business drive thee.”
この仕事は金になる
There is money in the work.
この仕事をお引受け下さいませんか
Will you undertake the work?
この仕事を引受けなけりゃよかった
I am sorry I ever undertook the work.
この仕事を頼まれた
I am entrusted with the work.
早速仕事に取りかかりましょう
I will go to work―set to work―set about my task―proceed to business―at once.
仕事は着手しましたか
Is the work in hand?
仕事はまだ着手しません
The work is not yet in hand.
早速仕事に着手させます
I shall put the work in hand without delay.
これが君の日日の仕事か
Is this your daily occupation?―Are these your daily pursuits?
食って寝るのが彼の日日の仕事だ
Eating and sleeping are his daily pursuits.
一日の仕事
a day's work
一日八時間の仕事
eight hours a day's work
相当の賃金に対する相当の仕事
a fair day's work for a fair day's wage
臨時仕事
an odd job
臨時仕事をする人
an odd man
賃仕事
job-work
仕事賃
a wage for work―a charge for work
針仕事
needlework
針仕事をする
to do needlework―(よそのなら)―take in needlework
仕事場
a workshop
仕事箱
a work-box
仕事着
working-clothes

〈名〉
1. A fireman (who does miscellaneous work)
2. (=仕事を計画する人)a man of enterprise; a man of resources

content:

〈名〉Carriage; bearing

content.content: あの女は身のしこなしが好い、しこなしが悪い

content:
しこなす〔仕こなす〕
〈他動〉To manage (a difficult matter); to adapt oneself to (a difficult part); to humour (a difficult part)

content.content: 僕にこの仕事が仕こなせるかしら
I wonder if I can manage the task.
役者が難役を仕こなす
An actor humours his part.
弁慶を仕こなす役者は少ない
Few actors can adapt themselves to the part of Benkei.

content:

〈名〉Education; training; breeding; teaching; tuition

content.content: 彼はお仕込みが好いからよく進みます
He is improving under your tuition.
お仕込のお蔭で私も一人前になりました
Thanks to your teaching, I am made a man of.

しこみづえ〔仕込杖〕
〈名〉A sword-cane

content:
しこむ〔仕込む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=教え込む)to teach (one something); to educate (one for something); to train, breed, bring up (a child to something)

content.content: 子どもに商売を仕込む
to train a child to some trade―breed a child to some trade―bring up a child to some trade
子どもに商売を仕込まぬ者は賊を養う
“He who brings up his son to nothing, breeds a thief.”
彼は武士の子で幼い時から武芸を仕込まれた
A samurai's son, he was early bred to arms.
法律を仕込む
to educate one for the law―breed one to the law
娘に遊芸を仕込む
to train a girl to female accomplishments―make a girl learn music and dancing
犬に芸を仕込む
to teach a dog tricks
この犬は種々の芸が仕込んである
The dog is trained to do many tricks.
小鳥は呼べば集まって来るように仕込んである
The birds are trained to come at your call.
馬を仕込む
to break in a horse―enter a horse

content:
2. (=仕入れる)to lay in (a stock of goods); to stock (some goods)
3. (=はめ込む)to fit (one thing into another)

content.content: 刀を杖に仕込む
to fit a sword into a cane

〈名〉One's own style; one's own way; one's own fashion

content.content: あの人は何をするにも自己流だ

I give up drinking from now on―from this day onward.

I should like to know you better―I hope you will know me better.

content:
しさい〔仔細〕
〈名〉
1. (=事由)circumstances; reasons

content.content: 仔細あって妻を離縁しました
I divorced my wife for certain reasons―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Circumstances obliged me to divorce my wife.
彼はなにか仔細があって辞職したのだろう
He must have resigned for reasons of his own.
いろいろ仔細があって国を出ました
I left home for various reasons.
これには仔細がございます
There are reasons for that.
これには深い仔細のあることだろう
There must be some deep reasons for it.

content: 2. (=重要)importance; consequence; significance

content.content: それは仔細ありません
It is of no consequence―It is no matter―It does not matter―It does not signify.
これは仔細無いことだと思う
I consider the matter of no consequence―hold the matter of no moment.
一つ二つの間違いは仔細無い
One or two mistakes are of no consequence―A mistake or two does not matter―does not signify.
どちらが勝とうと仔細無い
It does not matter―It makes no difference―which side may win.
もう何を食っても仔細ありません
You may eat anything you like.

content: 3. (=意味)meaning; significance

content.content: 仔細ありげに
meaningly―significantly―expressively
彼は仔細ありげな顔をしてそう言った
He said so with a significant look.
彼は仔細ありげに黙っていた
He preserved an expressive silence.

content: 4. (=委細)particulars; details:(=に) particularly; in detail

content.content: 仔細に物語る
to relate the affair in detail―enter into particulars―give full particulars

content: 5. (=勿体)consequence

content.content: 彼は仔細らしく口上を述べた
He gave his address with a consequential air.

content: 6. (=困難)difficulty; trouble

content.content: 仔細無くできます
It can be done without difficulty―without trouble.
事が仔細無く済んだ
The matter has been brought to an easy termination.

変転自在

雄弁家は人を泣かせるも笑わせるも活殺自在だ

〈名〉Suicide; self-destruction; felo-de-se:(=する) to commit suicide; to kill oneself; to destroy oneself; to make away with oneself; to take one's own life; to lay violent hands on oneself; to die by one's own hand

He committed a rash act.

首をくくって自殺する

身を投げて自殺する

content:
しさん〔資産〕
〈名〉Property; a fortune; means; assets; wealth

content.content: 彼はいくら資産が有るか
What is he worth?
百万の資産がある
He is worth a million.
百万の資産を残して死んだ

資産をこしらえる
to make a fortune―amass a fortune―accumulate a fortune
彼は相応な資産をこしらえた

(彼は働かずに食っていけるだけのいわゆる)独立資産が有る

content:
じじつ〔事実〕
〈名〉［注意］英語を標準とす。
1. A fact

content.content: 事実は小説よりも意外なり
“Fact is stranger than fiction.”
善かれ悪しかれ事実だからしかたがない
It may be right or wrong, but it is the fact.
こう言うとおかしいようだが事実はやはり事実だ
Strange as it may sound, it is a fact for all that.
事実ありのままを述べて各自の判断に任せる
I will state the facts as they are, and leave you to judge for yourselves.
歴史はこの事実に照らして読むべきである
History should be read in the light of these facts.
事実かくの如くなるをもって断罪するのは早計だ
In view of these facts, it is premature to conclude him guilty.
事実上そんなことはあり得べからざることだ
As a matter of fact, such a thing is impossible.
偶然妙な事実を発見した
I have lighted upon a curious fact by chance.
事実は争われぬ
There is no denying the fact―There is no gainsaying the fact―The fact is undeniable―The fact is not to be denied.
事実は打消せぬ
“Facts are stubborn things.”
その説は事実に反する
The statement is contrary to fact.
風説が事実となった
The rumour has become an accomplished fact.
これは事実に基づいて作った小説だ
The story is based upon fact.
事実を調査する
to inquire into the facts of the case
調査の結果、新事実が発覚した
On enquiry, some new facts have come to light.
新事実
new facts―new lights on the matter
事実を申し立てる
to state the facts
事実を隠す
to suppress a fact
事実を曲げる
to falsify the facts―juggle with facts
事実を無視する
to ignore a fact
都合の悪い事実をごまかしてしまう
to slur over an unfavourable fact
事実を洗ってみれば恋愛は繁殖本能に過ぎぬ
When we come own to the cold fact, love is nothing but the instinct of propagation.
明瞭な事実
an obvious fact
動かすべからざる事実
an established fact
注目すべき事実
a notable fact―a noteworthy fact―a fact worthy of note
歴然たる事実

この歴然たる事実が挙がったにもかかわらず彼は無罪を主張している
He asserts his innocence in the face of these glaring facts.
周知の事実
a patent fact

content: 2. The truth:(=の) true

content.content: その説は事実相違だ
The statement is not in accord with the truth.
その説には事実相違の点がある
The statement is not true in all particulars.
はばかりながらご説はちと事実と相違しております
With all respect for your opinion, your statement is not in strict accord with the truth.
事実を曲げる
to pervert the truth

夢が事実となった
My dream has come true.
これは事実談であって作り話ではない
This is a true account, and not a fictitious narrative.
耳の痛い事実を聞かしてやった
I told him a home truth.
飾りの無い事実

content: 3. A reality:(=の) real

content.content: この困難は事実であって想像でない

content.content: 事実かくの如くなるをもってぜひお待ちを願わねばならない

He is the virtual master.
Cromwell は事実上の王であった
Cromwell was all but a king―a king in all but the name.

content:

〈名〉
1. (=わけがら)Circumstances; reasons; account; case

content.content: 事情かくの如くなるをもって、ぜひお待ちを願わねばならぬ
Under these circumstances,―Such being the case,―I must request you to wait.
いかなる事情があっても嘘をつくものでない

content: 2. (=有様)the state of things; the state of matters; the state of affairs; conditions

content:

〈形〉
1. (音も無く動かないで静か)quiet:(動かないで静か)still:(音が無くて静か)silent:(音が低くて静か)soft; gentle; subdued:(穏かで静か)calm; tranquil; peaceful; placid; serene

content.content: この辺は静かだ
This is a quiet neighbourhood.
夜は殊に静かだ
It is especially so at night.
満堂水を打ったように静か
The house is hushed―Hushed silence reigns over the house―“A pin might be heard to drop.”
静かな人だ

二人は静かな声で話していた
They were talking in a gentle voice―in a subdued tone―in soft whispers.
皆静かに聴いておった
Everybody listened in silence―with silent attention.
静かに考えてみ給え

海上は静かだ

暴風雨の前はあまり静かで気味が悪い

静かな天候

静かな御世

静かに
Silence!―Hush!―(議会などでは)―Order!
静かになさい
Be quiet!―(動くなの意味なら)―Keep still!―(黙れの意味なら)―Hold your tongue!―Shut up!―(騒ぐなの意味なら)―Don't make such a noise!―(心を落着けての意味なら)―Calm yourself!―Compose yourself!
まあまあ静かに
Do be quiet!
お静かに願います
Please be quiet!
ここは独り者がおりますからどうぞお静かに願います

静かにしないと(ジタバタすると)命が無いぞ

静かに言っても話がわかる

静かになる
to become quiet―become calm―(騒ぎなら)―The noise quiets down―The tumult subsides―(風なら)―It falls calm―The wind goes down―The storm subsides―(世の中なら)―Peace is restored

to take exercise to excess
君はぜいたくを仕過ぎる
You are too extravagant―Your extravagance goes too far―You carry your extravagance too far―You carry your extravagance to excess.

content:
しずく〔雫〕
〈名〉A drop

content.content: 水の雫が滴る
Water drops.
着物から水の雫が滴る
My clothes are dripping.
露の雫
a dewdrop
涙の雫
a drop of tear

content:
しずけさ〔静けさ〕
〈名〉Quiet; stillness; silence; hush

content.content: けたたましき銃声が深夜の静けさを破った
A sharp report broke the stillness of the night.
暴風雨の前のような気味の悪い静けさであった
It was the ominous silence before a storm.

しずのお〔賤の男〕
〈名〉A humble man; a man of low birth

しずのめ〔賤の女〕
〈名〉A humble woman; a man of low birth

content:
じすべり〔地辷り〕
〈名〉A landslip

content.content: 地すべり地震
a dislocative earthquake

content:
しすます〔仕済ます〕
〈自動〉To accomplish one's purpose; to gain one's end; to succeed

content.content: 仕済ましたりとほくそ笑む
He chuckled to himself over his success.

content:
しずまりかえる〔静まり返る〕
〈自動〉To become hushed

content.content: 彼が演壇に立つと満堂水を打ったように静まり返る
When he ascends the platform, the whole house becomes hushed―hushed silence reigns over the house―“a pin might be heard to drop.”

content:
しずまる〔静まる〕
〈自動〉To become calm; to calm down; to become quiet; to quiet down; to settle down; to go down; to subside

content.content: 気が静まる、胸が静まる
One becomes calm―recovers one's composure.
人心が静まる
The public alarm is calmed.
騒ぎが静まる
The excitement subsides―The noise quiets down―(次第に)―The noise dies away.
騒動が静まった
The tumult has subsided―The disturbance has settled down.
風が静まる
It falls calm―The wind goes down―(だんだんと)―The wind dies away.
暴風雨が静まる
The storm subsides―The weather moderates.
暴風雨が暫く静まった
There is a lull in the storm.
波が静まる
The sea goes down.
天気が静まる
The weather moderates.
興奮した神経がだんだんと静まった
My excited nerves gradually calmed down.
世の中が静まった
Peace is restored.

content:
しずまる〔鎮まる〕
〈自動〉To be suppressed; to be repressed; to be subdued; to be quelled

content.content: 暴動が鎮まる
An insurrection is suppressed.
乱が鎮まった
The rebellion is subdued―The war is over.

content:
しずむ〔沈む〕
〈自動〉
1. (=水に沈む)to sink; to go down; to go to the bottom; to settle

content.content: 水中に沈む
to sink in the water
水より重いものは沈む
Anything that is heavier than water, sinks in it.
石は沈む
A stone sinks in the water.
石のように沈む
He will sink like lead.
深く沈む
to sink deep
船が暗礁に乗り上げて沈んだ
The ship ran on a rock and went down.
海底深く沈んだ
She went to the bottom.
船が沈んでいる
She is at the bottom (of the sea).
品川沖に船が一艘沈んでいる
There is a ship at the bottom off Shinagawa.
沈んだ船
a sunken ship―a submerged vessel
沈んだ船が浮き上がる
A sunken ship floats off.
船が今にも沈みそうだ
The ship is ready to sink.
船が沈み始める
A ship settles.
船が沈みかけた
The ship settled in the water.
船は見る見る沈む
The ship is fast settling.
彼は水中に沈んで再び浮かず
He sank beneath the waves, never to rise again.
彼はたちまち沈んで見えなくなった
He soon sank out of sight.
子どもを打っちゃっておけば浮く者は浮く沈むものは沈む
Leave a boy to sink or swim.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 五分間ばかり沈んでおった
I was under water about five minutes.
気が沈む
to have a heavy heart―be heavy-hearted―be depressed in spirits―be in low spirits―be in the dumps―be in the blues―have a fit of the blues―be grave―be pensive―be melancholy
身体が悪いと気が沈む
Ill health depresses me.
今日はたいそう沈んでいるじゃないか
You seem to be in low spirits today.
今日は気の沈む日だ
I am in the blues today―I have a fit of the blues today―The weather is depressing.
彼は浮くかと思うと沈み、沈むかと思うと浮く(変転自在だ)
He will pass from gay to grave, from grave to gay.
彼は物思いに沈んでいる
He is lost in thoughts―in a pensive mood.
一家は憂いに沈んでいる
The family are plunged in grief.
彼女は沈みがちの性だ
She is of a pensive disposition―of a melancholy temperament.

しずめに〔沈め荷〕
〈名〉Jetsam; jettisoned cargo:(=する) to jettison cargo

content:
しずめる〔静める〕
〈他動〉To calm (one's mind); to quiet (clamour); to still (the passions); to soothe (the nerves); to pacify, appease (one's anger); to allay, alleviate, assuage, mitigate (pain)

content.content: 心を静める、気を静める、胸を静める
to calm oneself―compose oneself―collect oneself
心を静めて考えてみた
I composed myself to think.
気を静めて考えてご覧
Compose yourself and reflect!
人心を静める
to calm the public alarm
ようようのことで群集の騒ぎを静めた
At last I succeeded in quieting the popular clamour.
騒動を静める
to calm the disturbance―“pour oil on the troubled waters”
情慾を静める
to still the passions
感情を静める
to soothe one's feelings
興奮した神経を静める
to calm one's excited nerves
人の怒りを静める
to pacify one's anger―appease one's anger
疼痛を静める
to allay pain―alleviate pain―assuage pain―mitigate pain

content:
しずめる〔沈める〕
〈他動〉
1. To sink; to submerge; to send (anything) to the bottom

content.content: 敵艦を沈める
to sink the enemy―send the enemy to the bottom
戦闘艦が沈められた
A battleship was sunk.
全村海中に沈められた
A whole village was submerged in the sea.
苦界に身を沈める
to live a life of shame

content:
しずめる〔鎮める〕
〈他動〉To suppress, repress, subdue, quell, put down (a rebellion); to settle (a dispute or a quarrel)

content.content: 乱を鎮める
to suppress a rebellion―subdue a rebellion
内乱を鎮める
to put down a civil war
けんかを鎮める
to settle a quarrel―pacify the combatants―part the combatants
国を守り世を鎮むるは武士にこそありけれ
It is the samurai who defends the country and preserves peace.

content:
しする〔死する〕
〈自動〉To die; to decease; to perish; to expire; to be killed

content.content: 士は己を知る人の為に死す
A samurai dies for one who appreciates him.
人死せんとするやその言うことや善し
You should listen to the words of a dying man.
死すべき時に死せざれば死に勝る恥あり
One must sometimes choose between death and dishonour―One must sometimes die or live in dishonour.
正義に死して百世に生く
to die in the cause of justice and live in the memory of posterity
生きて恥をさらさんよりは死するに如かず
I would rather die than live in dishonour.
死すとも恥掻くな
Death before dishonour!
死すとも盗泉の水を飲まず
I would rather die than batten on ill-gotten gains.
死すとも止まぬ決心だ
I will do or die in the attempt.
死して後止む決心だ
I am determined to do or die.
虎死して皮を残す
A tiger leaves a skin behind him.
人死して名を残す
A man leaves a name behind him.
死して余栄あり
Honour blossoms on his grave.

content:
しする〔視する〕
〈接尾動詞〉To regard, look on, consider (anything as something)

content.content: 彼は僕を恩人視している
He looks upon me as a benefactor.
彼女は彼を子ども視している
She regards him as a child.
彼は子どもを厄介視している
He regards his children as so many encumbrances.

content:
しする〔資する〕
〈他動〉To furnish materials for (anything); to furnish (anything); to help (anything); to contribute to (success); to conduce to (one's welfare, etc.)

content.content: 参考に資す
to furnish materials for reference
かかる発明は工業の発達に資するならん
Such inventions will contribute to the development of industry.
かくの如き事業は国家の繁栄に資すること大なるべし
Such enterprises must conduce greatly to the prosperity of the country.

content:
じする〔侍する〕
〈他動〉To attend on (one's master); to wait on (a guest)

content.content: 君側に侍す
to attend on one's lord
宴会に侍す
to wait at a banquet

content:
じする〔持する〕
〈他動〉
1. (=身を持つ)to hold

content.content: 恭謙己を持す
to hold oneself with modesty―to be modest in behaviour
彼は己を持する厳なり
He is strict with himself.

content: 2. (=守る)to observe

content.content: 五戒を持する
to observe the commandments

じする〔治する〕
〈他動〉To cure (a disease―one of a disease); to heal (a wound―one of a wound)

content:
じする〔辞する〕
〈他動〉
1. (=辞職する)to resign (one's post or office); to throw up (one's office); to lay down (one's duties); to leave (one's place)

content.content: 職を辞す、官を辞す
to resign one's office―resign one's post
彼は校長を辞した
He has resigned the post of principal―resigned as principal.
政権を辞す
to drop the reins of government

content: 2. (=辞退する)to decline

content.content: 提供を辞した
I declined the offer.
彼は招待をいくら辞しても聞かぬ
He would not listen to my declension of his invitation―He would take no denial.
国家の為には死も辞せぬ
I am ready to die for my country.
好敵手と一快戦を試みるは敢て辞するところにあらず
I have no objection to crossing swords with a foeman worthy of my steel.
公益の為にはいかなることをも辞すべきでものでない
We must be prepared to give any amount of labour for the good of the public.

content: 3. (=暇乞いする)to take one's leave; to bid (one) adieu; to leave (a house)

content.content: 日の暮れに田中方を辞した
I left Tanaka's at nightfall.
親の膝元を辞す
to bid adieu to one's paternal roof
この世を辞す
to depart this life―die

しせい〔四声〕
〈名〉The four tones (of Chinese characters)

content:
しせい〔始政〕
〈名〉Inauguration of a new administration

content.content: 朝鮮始政十年祭
the Tenth Anniversary of the New Administration of Chosen

content:
しせい〔姿勢〕
〈名〉A posture; an attitude; a pose; a poise; a plant; carriage

content.content: 姿勢を正す
to assume a proper posture―draw oneself up―straighten oneself
気をつけの姿勢をとる
to stand at attention
直立不動の姿勢をとる
to assume an erect and immobile posture
防衛の姿勢をとる
to assume a defensive attitude―put oneself in a posture of defence―throw oneself into a posture of defence
彼は姿勢が好い
He carries himself well―He has a fine carriage―an erect carriage.
この馬は頭の姿勢が好い
The horse carries his head well.
馬上の姿勢優美なり
He has a graceful seat on horseback.

content:
しせい〔市井〕
〈名〉The street

content.content: 市井の徒
street arabs

content:
しせい〔市制〕
〈名〉Municipal system; municipal organization

content.content: 市制を布く
to municipalize a town―organize a town as a municipality
この町は今度市制になる、市制を布くことになる
The town will be municipalized―a municipality―organized as a municipality.

content:
しせい〔市政〕
〈名〉Municipal administration; municipal government

content.content: 市政を改革する
to reform the municipal administration
市政改革
civic reform
市政改良
civic improvement

content:
しせい〔施政〕
〈名〉Administration; government; conduct of affairs:(=の) administrative

content.content: 責任内閣は議会に対して施政の責任あり
A responsible cabinet is responsible to the Diet for the conduct of affairs.
現内閣は施政の方針を誤った
The present Cabinet has mistaken its administrative policy.

content:
しせい〔死生〕
〈名〉Life and death

content.content: 死生命あり
Life and death are decreed by Heaven―(戦場で言えば)―“Every bullet has its billet.”
君と死生を共にする
I will share your fate.
皆死生を誓った
They all swore to share the same fate.
死生を顧みず
He carries his life in one's hands―He makes nothing of dying.
死生の巷に出入する
to take one's life in one's hands―run into the jaws of death
彼は死生の巷に出入して活動した
He bestirred himself in the very jaws of death.

content:
しせい〔私製〕
〈形〉Privately-made

content.content: 私製葉書
a private postcard

content:
しせい〔紙製〕
〈形〉Made of paper

content.content: 紙製石盤
a paper slate

content:
しせい〔至誠〕
〈名〉Sincerity; zeal; devotion; singleness of heart; whole-heartedness:(=の) sincere; zealous; devoted; single-hearted; whole-hearted

content.content: 言々至誠より出づ
Every word of his comes from a sincere heart.
至誠天に通ず、至誠天に勝つ
Zeal will move Heaven and earth―(に相当するは)“Faith will move a mountain.”

しせい〔詩聖〕
〈名〉A divine poet; an inspired poet

content:
しせい〔資性〕
〈名〉Disposition

content.content: 資性温厚
He is of a mild disposition.

しぜい〔市税〕
〈名〉A municipal tax

content:
じせい〔時世〕
〈名〉The age; the times

content.content: 時世に後れる
to fall behind the times
あの学校は時世に後れている
That school is behind the times.
この軍艦は時世後れだ
The ship is out of date―old-fashioned.
時世後れの人
a superannuated person―an old fogey―a back number―an antediluvian
時世に後れぬようにする、時世と共に進む
to keep pace with the times―keep abreast of the times―move with the times―keep in touch with the times
時世に後れるな
Keep abreast of the times!
新聞を読むと時世に後れない
The papers will keep you abreast of the times.
彼は時世に通じている、時世に明るい
He is in touch with the times.
新聞を読むから時世に明るい
The papers keep him in touch with the times.
彼は時世に疎い、時世に暗い
He is out of touch with the times.
引込んでいるから時世に暗い
His retired life keeps him out of touch with the times.
時世に先んずる
to get ahead of the age
彼は時世に先んじている、時世に合わぬ
He is ahead of his age.
彼の思想は時世よりも十年進んでいる
His ideas are ten years ahead of the age.

content:
じせい〔時勢〕
〈名〉The spirit of the age; the spirit of the times; the trend of events

content.content: 時勢に従う
to follow the spirit of the times―swim with the tide―swim with the stream―swim with the current
時勢に逆らう
to run counter to the spirit of the age―swim against the tide―swim against the stream―swim against the current
時勢には勝てぬ
There is no contending against the times.
時勢が英雄を作るか英雄が時勢を作るか
Does the age create the hero, or the hero the age?
時勢の向かうところを察する
to observe the trend of events

content:
じせい〔磁性〕
〈名〉Magnetism:(=の) magnetic

content.content: 磁性体
a magnetic body

じせい〔自省〕
〈名〉Self-examination; self-review; introspection:(=する) to examine oneself; to review one's life; to introspect

content:
じせい〔自制〕
〈名〉Self-control; self-command; self-restraint; continence:(=する) to control oneself; to restrain oneself; to contain oneself

content.content: 彼は自制力に乏しい
He has no control over himself―He is incontinent.

content:
じせい〔自成〕
〈形〉Self-made

content.content: 自成の人
a self-made man

じせい〔自生〕
〈名〉Spontaneous generation; wild growth:(=する) to grow wild

content:
じせい〔自製〕
〈形〉Home-made

content.content: 自製品
home-made articles

content:
じせい〔辞世〕
〈名〉A farewell poem; a death-song; a swan-song; a poem written on one's deathbed

content.content: 辞世一首を留めて従容として死に就いた
He composed a farewell poem, and calmly met his end.

しぜいかん〔司税官〕
〈名〉A controller of taxes; an exciseman

content:
しせいじ〔私生児〕
〈名〉An illegitimate child; a child born out of wedlock; a bastard; a natural child; a love-child; a misbegotten child; a side-slip; a by-blow

content.content: 彼は私生児だ
He was born out of wedlock―born on the wrong side of the blanket.
娘が私生児を産んだ
She gave birth to a love-child―bore a child out of wedlock.
私生児を認知する
to acknowledge a child―recognize a child―own a child

content:
しせいちょうさ〔市勢調査〕
〈名〉Municipal census-taking

content.content: 市勢調査を行う
to take the municipal census

content:
しせき〔史蹟〕
〈名〉Historic remains; a historic site; a place of historical interest; a place of historical associations

content.content: この地方は史蹟に富んでいる
This part of the country is rich in historic remains―The place abounds in historical associations.
箱根には曾我兄弟の史蹟がある
Hakone is associated with the Soga brothers.
史蹟を踏査する
to explore a historic site

content:
しせき〔咫尺〕
〈名〉A very short distance; close proximity:(=する) to approach

content.content: 暗黒咫尺を弁ぜず
It is so dark that one can not see an inch before one.
咫尺を弁ぜざる暗黒
pitch-darkness―Cimmerian night
天顔に咫尺する
to be presented to the Emperor―have an audience of the Emperor

content:
じせき〔事績〕
〈名〉Achievements; services; merits; deeds; a record

content.content: 偉人の事績
the deeds of great men
彼は過失を償うだけの事績がある
He has enough merits to set off against his faults.
彼は農商務大臣として大いに事績を挙げた
He rendered great services―left a good record―as Minister of Agriculture and Commerce.
彼の事績は永く歴史に伝えらるべし
His achievements will long be transmitted in history.

じせき〔事跡〕
〈名〉An evidence; a fact

content:
じせき〔次席〕
〈名〉(事)being next in position; juniority:(人)a junior official

content.content: 彼は校長の次席だ
He is next to the principal in position.
課長が不在で次席が代理している
The chief being absent, his junior acts for him.

じせき〔自責〕
〈名〉Self-reproach:(=する) to reproach oneself

content:
しせつ〔使節〕
〈名〉An envoy; an ambassador; a minister

content.content: 使節に行く
to go on an embassy

content:
しせつ〔施設〕
〈名〉Institution; establishment; provision; equipment; proceedings; doings:(=する) to institute; to establish; to provide; to equip

content.content: 社会の施設
the institutions of society
法律の施設
the provisions of the law
大都会の施設
the equipment of a great city
教育施設
educational equipments
日本の朝鮮における施設
Japan's doings in Korea.

content:
しせつ〔私設〕
〈名〉Private establishment:(=の) private

content.content: 私設鉄道
a private railway

しぜつ〔死絶〕
〈名〉Extinction:(=する) to become extinct; to die out

content:
じせつ〔持説〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: じろん〔持論〕

content:
じせつ〔時節〕
〈名〉
1. (=季節)season; the time of the year

content.content: 今は遊猟の好時節だ
Now is the season for shooting.
時節の物
things in season
カキは時節のものだ
Oysters are now in season.
筍は時節はずれだ
Bamboo shoots are out of season.
時節柄お大事になさい
You must be particularly careful of yourself at this time of the year.

content: 2. (=時期)one's time; due time; opportunity; chance

content.content: 時節を待つ
to bide one's time
彼は世を忍んで時節を待っている
He lies low and bides his time.
腕を磨いて時節を待て
Keep your hand in, and watch for a chance.
時節を待てば、時節が来れば
in time―in due time―in due season―in due course of time―in the fulness of time
時節を待てば人になる
The boy will become a useful man in time.
時節が来ればわかる
Time will show.
時節を待てよ時鳥{ほととぎす}
The bird will sing in due season.
時節到来
My time has come―My hour has struck―My clock has struck.
時節到来して事が成就した
The thing succeeded in the fulness of time.
辛抱して待てばいつか時節が来る
“Everything comes to those who wait.”
まだ時節が来ない
My time has not come.
また逢う時節もあろう
We may meet again.

content: 3. (=時世)the times

content.content: 時節と諦めよう、時世(ときよ)時節だ
I must take the times as they are.
時節柄うっかりしたことは言えぬ
One must speak guardedly in view of the times.

content:
じせつ〔自説〕
〈名〉One's own opinion; one's own view

content.content: 自説を主張する
to maintain one's opinion
彼は自説に執着している、自説を曲げぬ
He is wedded to his opinion―He holds fast to his opinion.
彼は自説を張り通した
He persisted in his views to the end.

content:
じせつがら〔時節柄〕
〈副〉At this time of the year; in view of the times; in view of the situation

content.content: 時節柄お大事になさい
You must be particularly careful of yourself at this time of the year.
時節柄うっかりしたことは言えない
One must speak guardedly in view of the times.
(コレラ流行などの時)時節柄食物に注意しなければならぬ
We must be careful what we eat in view of the situation.

content:
しせん〔支線〕
〈名〉A branch line

content.content: 塩釜線は奥州線の支線である
The Shiogama line is a branch to the Oshu line.

しせん〔死戦〕
〈名〉A desperate fight

〈名〉A private line

〈名〉The line of sight; the line of vision

content.content: 視線を向ける
to turn one's eyes on―look at―anything
皆の視線は彼の方へ向いた
All eyes were turned upon him.
世界の視線が日本に集まった
The eyes of the world were focussed upon Japan―Japan was the cynosure of the world―Japan was the observed of all observers.
二人の視線が合ってピクリとした
Their eyes met, and they started.

〈名〉A great poet

content:

content.content: 賜饌を賜わる
to be entertained at an Imperial luncheon

content:
しぜん〔至善〕
〈名〉The highest good; the supreme good; summum bonum

content.content: 人生の至善に達する
to attain the summum bonum of life―become one with God

content:
しぜん〔自然〕
〈名〉
1. Nature:(=の) natural; native; wild; instinctive; spontaneous; inherent; inborn; unacquired; unearned:(=に) naturally; instinctively, by instinct; spontaneously, of itself

content.content: 自然は渾然として玉の如し
Nature is a whole.
家鴨が水へ入るのは自然だ
It is natural that the duck should take to the water.
あの人の演説ぶりは自然でない(不自然だ)
His manner of speaking is not natural―artificial.
自然のなりゆき
the course of nature
自然のなりゆきに任せる
to let nature take her course
物事を自然のなりゆきに任せよ
Let things take their course!
事件を自然のなりゆきに任した
The matter was allowed to take its own course.
自然の法則
the laws of nature―natural laws
自然の法則に従わざる物無し
All things are subject to natural laws.
自然の法則に背く
to outrage nature
自然の法則には背かれぬ
Nature will be obeyed.
自然に反する
to be contrary to nature―against nature―unnatural
男色は自然に反する大罪
Sodomy is a crime against nature.
自然の結果
a natural consequence
そうすれば自然の結果として職務を怠るようになる
Then it follows as a natural consequence―naturally follows―that he will neglect his duties.
生者必滅は自然の理
Loving things die in the course of nature.
年頃になると自然の慾求が出る
Nature asserts herself at the age of puberty.
自然を写す
to copy from nature
自然に倣う
to copy nature
日本の園芸は自然を写したものだ
Japanese gardening is copied from nature.
自然を友とする
to commune with nature
自然を楽しむ
to enjoy nature
動物は毒な物を自然に知っている
Animals know by instinct what is poisonous.
自然の知識
instinctive knowledge―unacquired knowledge
この権利はその職務に自然に属するものである
The right is inherent in the office.
自然に具わった品格
a native dignity
打っちゃっておけば自然に死んでしまう
If left to himself, he will die of himself―he will die in the course of nature.
草は(種を蒔かないでも)自然に生える
Weeds grow of themselves.
傷は打っちゃっておけば自然に治る
The wound, if left to itself, will heal of itself―heal itself.
この病気は自然に治る
This disease will cure itself.
事件は自然に解決する
The matter will settle itself.
その話が誰いうとなく自然に本人の耳に入った
The story came to the ears of the party concerned in the natural course of things.
やっているうちに自然と呼吸がわかって来る
If you keep at it, you will naturally get the knack of doing it.
身体の弱い子どもは自然学問にこりたがる
A boy with a weak constitution will fling himself into books.
どちらが無理だか時が経てば自然とわかる
Time will show which is in the wrong.
酒を飲むと自然職務を怠りがちになる
A drunkard will neglect his duties―A man who is given to drinking is apt to neglect his duties.

content:
2. 
〈複合詞〉

content.content: 自然界
the natural world―nature
自然界の美と人工界の美
beauty in nature and in art
自然の美
the beauties of nature
自然美
natural beauty―inborn beauty―inherent beauty
自然生の植物
wild plants
自然木
a wild tree
自然力
natural agencies
自然淘汰
natural selection
自然消滅
natural death
問題は自然消滅になった
The question died a natural death.
自然金
natural gold
自然宗教
a natural religion
自然神教
deism
自然崇拝
natural worship―elemental worship
自然主義
naturalism
自然主義者
a naturalist
自然療法
a nature-cure―the expectant method
(Spencer の)自然発生論
spontaneous generation
自然発生論とは天地は自然にできたということ
Spontaneous generation signifies that the universe came into being of itself.
(大酒家にあるという)自然燃焼
spontaneous combustion
自然運動
spontaneous movement―autokinesis
自然増収
unearned increment
自然趣味
unacquired taste

content:

content.content: 事前従犯者
an accessory before the fact

content:
じぜん〔慈善〕
〈名〉Charity; benevolence; philanthropy:(=の) charitable; benevolent; eleemosynary

content.content: 慈善を行う
to practise charity―feed the hungry and clothe the naked
貧民に慈善を施す
to give to the poor in charity―give alms to the poor
彼は慈善の為に奔走する
He interests himself in the cause of charity.
慈善は近きより始まる
“Charity begins at home.”
慈善を商売にする者がある
Some people trade on charity.
慈善家
a charitable person―a benevolent individual―a philanthropist
慈善事業
charitable works―works of charity
慈善心
benevolence
慈善会
an eleemosynary institution―a charitable institution―a charity
慈善音楽会
a charity concert
慈善市
a charity bazaar
慈善病院
a charity hospital
慈善学校
a charity school
慈善鍋
a charity pot

content:
じぜんか〔慈善家〕
〈名〉A charitable person; a benevolent individual; a philanthropist

content.content: 真の慈善家は右の手の為すことを左の手に知らしめぬ
True charity leis not the left hand know what the right hand does.

content:
じぜんかい〔慈善会〕
〈名〉An eleemosynary institution; a charitable institution; a charity

content.content: 収益は慈善会へ寄付する
We shall give the profits to the charities.

content:
じぜんじぎょう〔慈善事業〕
〈名〉Charitable works; works of charity; philanthropic work

content.content: 収益は慈善事業に寄付する
We shall give the profits in charity.

content:
じぜんしん〔慈善心〕
〈名〉Benevolence

content.content: あれは慈善心のある人だ
He is a benevolent man―a man of charitable disposition.

content.content: Bacon は科学の始祖として仰がれている
Bacon is looked up to as the father of science.

content:
しそう〔志操〕
〈名〉Constancy; principle; purpose

content.content: 堅固な志操
a firm purpose
彼は志操堅固な人だ
He has a firm purpose.
今時の学生は志操の堅固を欠いている
Students nowadays are infirm of purpose.

content:
しそう〔思想〕
〈名〉A thought; an idea; a conception; a sentiment

content.content: 思想は言葉をもって表白する
Thoughts are expressed by means of words―We express our thoughts by means of words.
言葉は思想を伝える
Words convey ideas―Words are the vehicles of thoughts.
思想に言葉の着物を着せる
We clothe ideas in words.
彼は思想が豊富だ
He is full of ideas―rich in ideas.
彼の頭は思想に富んでいる
He has a pregnant head.
彼は思想に乏しい
He is poor in ideas―devoid of ideas.
彼の頭は思想に乏しい
He has an empty head.
彼は筆は立つが思想が貧弱だ
He writes well, but his ideas are meagre.
思想に乏しい作だ
It is a meagre work―a lean work.
彼は思想が涸渇した
His ideas are exhausted.
Carlyle は思想が好い
I like Carlyle for the sake of his ideas.
彼の思想は時世よりも十年進んでいる
His ideas are ten years ahead of the age.
美しい思想は自ら詩になる
Beautiful sentiments naturally take the form of poetry.
彼は思想ができている
His judgment is matured by reflection.
新思想
new ideas―new conceptions―(悪く言えば)―new-fangled notions
彼は新思想の入りやすい頭を持っている
He has a mind receptive of new ideas.
新奮思想の衝突
a collision of old and new ideas
文学思想
literary ideas
危険思想
dangerous thoughts―pernicious principles―a seditious propaganda
海事思思
a maritime spirit
国民の海事思想を養う
to arouse public interest in maritime affairs
軍事思想
a military spirit
国民の軍事思想を養う
to arouse public interest in military affairs
政治思想
political ideas
国民の政治思想を養う
to foster political ideas in the people
国民思想
the national sentiment
国民思想の醗酵
storm and stress
思想感情
thoughts and feelings―sentiments
思想界
the world of thought―the intellectual world

content:

content.content: 彼の顔には死相が有る

Millions, if allowed to lie idle, will avail you nothing.

content:
じぞく〔持続〕
〈名〉Maintenance; sustenance; support; endurance; continuance:(=する) to maintain (a war); to sustain (one's credit); to support (a character); to keep up (a conversation):(自動詞に用いれば)to endure; to last; to hold out; to stand out; to continue; to stay

content.content: 戦争を持続する
to maintain a war
そんなことをしては人格を持続することができない
I can not do such a thing, for I must sustain my character―support my character.
信用を持続せねばならぬ
I must sustain my credit―keep up my credit.
君は英語で談話を持続することができるか
Can you keep up a conversation in English?
正義は永遠に持続する
Justice endures for ever.
この状態は長くは持続すまい
This state of things can not last long.
この種の雑誌で長く持続するのは少ない
Few of these magazines continue long in existence.
あの銀行はもう持続することは難い
That bank can not hold out any longer.
持続力
sustaining power―staying power―stay
若い者は持続力が無い
Young men have no stay in them.

content:

content.content: 時俗に従う
to conform to the age

しそくるい〔四足類〕

content.content: 将校と士卒
officers and men

content:
しそん〔子孫〕
〈名〉Descendants; posterity; offspring

content.content: 全村平家の子孫である
The whole village is descended from the Taira family―The villagers are descendants of the Taira family.
子孫に伝える
to transmit anything to posterity―hand down anything from father to son
子孫の為に図る
to labour for the good of posterity
子孫の為に美田を買わず
I will not leave broad acres to my posterity.
大名は子孫の繁栄を図るために妾を蓄えた
The daimyos kept concubines that they might leave a numerous offspring.

〈名〉The lord paramount; His Majesty; the Emperor

〈名〉Self-existence:(=の) self-existent:(=する) to exist of oneself

content:

〈名〉Self-respect; self-importance; egotism; amour propre:(=の) self-important:(=する) to respect oneself

content.content: あれは自尊家だ
He is a self-important personage.
自尊の無い人は尊敬する価値が無い
One who does not respect oneself is unworthy of respect.

content:
しそんじ〔仕損じ〕
〈名〉A failure; a mistake; an error; a blunder; a bungle; a miss; a miscarriage:(=る) to fail; to blunder; to bungle; to miscarry; to make a mistake; to commit an error; to commit a blunder; to miss one's mark; to miss one's tip

content.content: 誰だって仕損じはある
“Man is liable to error.”
仕損じては一大事
What if I should fail!
名人にも仕損じあり
“A good marksman may miss”―“It is a wise man who never makes mistakes.”
急いては事を仕損じる
“Haste is waste.”
手が慣れると仕損じが無い
One comes to act with a firm hand―with a steady hand.

content:
じそんしん〔自尊心〕
〈名〉Pride

content.content: 彼は自尊心がある
He is proud.
自尊心が無い
He has no pride.
自尊心を傷つける
to wound one's pride

content:
した〔下〕
〈名〉
1. The lower part; the bottom; the ground; the floor:(=の) lower; under; subordinate:(=に) below:(=へ) down:(二階からなら)downstairs

content.content: 山の下
the foot of a hill
坂の下
the foot of a slope
坂の下に橋がある
There is a bridge at the foot of the slope.
階段の下
the bottom of the stairs
梯子段の下に立っていた
He was standing at the bottom of the stairs.
上から下まで家の中を捜した
The house was searched from top to bottom.
下へ降りる
to go down―come down―(二階からなら)―go downstairs―come downstairs
彼は下に居る
He is downstairs.
下におろう
Keep low!―Down on your knees!
下へ下がる
to go down―come down
話が下へ下がる
The talk comes down to the dregs―The talk becomes foul―The conversation degenerates.
下へ落ちる
to fall down―fall to the ground
下に落ちている
It is on the ground―on the floor.
下に置く
to put down―set down―lay down―(no the ground or floor)
下にも置かぬもてなしぶり
They were assiduous in their attentions to him―They paid him sedulous attentions―They overhelmed him with attentions.
下を見る、下を向く
to look down―look on the ground―cast one's eyes on the ground―lower one's eyes
下を向いて立っている
She is standing with her eyes cast down―with her eyes on the ground.
二階下
the ground floor―(は英、米は)―the first story
彼は下の組です
He is in the lower class.
下の間に居る
He is in the downstairs room.
僕は席順はずっと下です
I am low down in the class.
下の註をご覧
Read the foot-notes.
下に下がある
Look below you!
家の中は上を下への混雑
The house is topsyturvy.
下から三番目の抽斗
the third drawer from the bottom
下から二行目
the second line from the bottom―the last line but one
下の位置を取る
to take a subordinate position―play second fiddle
下から出る
to condescend―humble oneself
君の方がそう下から出たら先方でも心が解けるだろう
If you humble yourself so far, he will relent.
下から出りゃつけ上がり
You presume upon my condescension.

content: 2. (=代金の一部分の代りに渡す品)an article given in part payment

content.content: 古いのを下に取ってくれるか
Will you take my old one in part payment?

content: 〈前置詞相当〉(真下)under:(下方)below:(接して下)beneath:(劣等)inferior to (the other)

content.content: 卓の下に
under the table
食卓の下から這い出す者がある
Some come out from under the table.
彼は寝台の下に隠れた
He concealed himself under the bed.
橋の下を潜る
to pass under a bridge
天が下にこんな善い国は無い
This is the best land under the sun.
雷雨の時は大木の下に雨宿りするな
Do not take shelter under a tree in a thunderstorm.
木下に休んだ
I rested myself under the shade of a tree.
縁の下に、床下に一人の男が潜んでおった
A man was concealed under the floor.
雌鶏は羽交いの下に雛を集める
A hen gathers her chickens under her wings.
誰か窓の下に立ち聞きしている
Somebody is eavesdropping under the window.
生徒は脇の下に本を抱えて出て来る
The students come out with their books under their arms.
人の下に付く
to work under a man―take a subordinate position―play second fiddle
あんな奴の下に使われるのはいやだ
I don't like to work under―serve under―such a fellow.
百円より下では売れない
I can't sell it under 100 yen.
一カ月より下ではできません
I can't have it ready under a month.
彼は四十より下ではあるまい
He can not be under forty―below forty.
大将は大臣の上か下か
Is a general above or below a Cabinet-minister?
私は彼より位が下です
I am below him in rank.
席順も彼より下です
I am below him in the class.
彼より一級下です
I am a grade below him.
甲は乙より腕が下だ
A is inferior to B in ability.
僕は君より年が(三ツ)下だ
I am (three years) younger than you―I am your junior (by three years).
敷物の下に藁を敷け
Put some straw beneath the carpet.
彼はこの下に葬ってある
He lies beneath this grave.
彼は家が倒れてその下になった
He was buried beneath the debris of a fallen house.
下に油紙を敷く
to place an oil-paper beneath.
下に板を敷かないと書きにくい
I must have a board beneath to write on.

content: 〈接頭詞〉Lower; under; subordinate; sub-

content.content: 下唇
the lower lip―the under lip
下顎
the lower jaw―the under jaw
下着
underwear
下座敷
a downstairs room
下働き
subordinate work
下職人
a subworker
下稽古
rehearsal―preparation
下ごしらえ
preliminary arrangements
下調べ
reading up―preparation

content:
した〔舌〕
〈名〉
1. The tongue; the unruly member:(=の) lingual

content.content: 舌を出す
to put out one's tongue
彼は僕に向かって舌を出した
He thrust out his tongue at me.
(医者が患者に向かって)舌をお見せなさい
(Show me) your tongue!
蔭で舌を出す
to put one's tongue in one's cheek―laugh in one's sleeve
舌を噛む
to bite (out) one's tongue
舌を噛んで死ぬ
to kill oneself by biting one's tongue out
舌を使う、舌を揮るう
to wag one's tongue
舌を二枚に使う
to be double-tongued
舌を二枚に使うな
Do not keep two tongues in one mouth!―Avoid duplicity in speech!
舌をなめる
to like one's chaps
舌が荒れる
The tongue roughens.
舌が荒れて味がしない
My tongue is so rough that I can not taste anything.
酸っぱい果物を食うと舌が荒れる
Sour fruits roughen the tongue.
舌が真白だ(白苔がついている)
My tongue is coated with fur.
舌が滑ったのだ(言い損い)
It was a slip of the tongue.
舌を滑らす
to talk unguardedly
つい舌を滑らして人の悪口を言った
I indulged in a malicious remark.
舌の先
the tip of one's tongue
舌の先でごまかす
to talk anything away
唐辛は舌を刺戟する
Red pepper bites the tongue.
暑いと犬の舌がダラリと垂れる
A dog's tongue lolls out in summer.
犬が舌をダラリと垂れる
A dog lolls his tongue out.
舌が長い
He has a long tongue―a thick utterance.
子どもは舌がまわらぬ
A child lisps.
酒に酔うと舌がまわらぬ
A drunken man has a thick voice.
彼は酒に酔うと舌がまわらなくなる
When he gets drunk, he becomes thick in speech.
彼は舌がまわらないから酔っている
He must be drunk, for he has a thick voice.
彼はよく舌がまわる
He talks well―He has the gift of the gab.
(馬を励ますために)舌を鳴らす
to cluck
舌を巻く
to be outtalked―be dumfounded―be astonished
彼の弁舌には皆舌を巻いた
Everybody was astonished at his eloquence.
試験官に舌を巻かした
He astonished his examiners.
舌の根の乾かぬ中に変説した
He contradicted himself in the same breath.
言一度出づれば駟{し}も舌に及ぼす
A word once uttered is not to be recalled.

content: 2. (=鐘の舌)the clapper (of a bell)

じた〔自他〕
〈名〉Self and others:(哲学にては)subject and object

content.content: 自他の関係
one's relations to others
自他の物
meum and tuum
彼は自他の物を区別しない
He does not distinguish between meum and tuum.

content:
じだ〔耳朶〕
〈名〉The ear-lobe:(より)the ear

content.content: 耳朶に触れる
to come to one's ears―reach one's ears

したあご〔下顎〕
〈名〉The lower jaw; the under jaw

content:
したい〔仕度い〕
〈他動〉I wish, want, should like (to do something); I feel like (doing something); I feel inclined, feel disposed (to do something):(形容詞を以て表わせば)I am desirous, eager, anxious, impatient, dying (to do something)

content.content: 洋行したい
I wish to go abroad―I am desirous to go abroad.
洋行したいものだ
I should like to go abroad.
洋行したいような気がする
I feel like going abroad―feel inclined to go abroad―feel disposed to go abroad.
どうかして成功したいものだ
I am anxious to succeed―anxious for success.
孝行をしたい時には親は無し
When I wish to be a good son, my parents are no more.

したい〔枝隊〕
〈名〉A detachment (of troops)

content:
したい〔死体〕
〈名〉A corpse; a dead body; one's remains:(解剖する死体)a subject; a cadaver:(動物の死体)a carcase

content.content: 人が死ぬと死体は地に葬られる
When a man dies, his remains are consigned to the earth.
死体は遺族に引き渡された
His remains were handed over to his family.
死体を引き取る
to claim one's remains
死体の引き取り手が無い
No one claims his remains.
網を引いて死体を捜索した
They dragged (the river) for the body―The sea was dragged for the body.
死体を解剖する
to dissect a body
死体解剖
a post-mortem (examination)―autopsy
死体解剖の結果毒殺と判明した
a post-mortem showed that he was poisoned
解剖用死体
a subject for dissection―a cadaver
死体検察
the coroner's inquest
死体発掘
exhumation of a body
死体強直
rigor mortis
死体毒
ptomaine

content:
したい〔死胎〕
〈名〉A dead foetus

content.content: 死胎分娩
a still birth
死胎児
a still-born child

しだい〔四大〕
〈名〉The four elements of Chinese philosophy (earth, water, fire, and wind)

content:
しだい〔至大〕
〈形〉Vast; immense; enormous; prodigious; tremendous; stupendous

content.content: 米国は至大なる財源を有する
America has vest resources―immense resources―enormous resources.
王政御一新は至大なる鴻業であった
The Restoration was a prodigious achievement―a stupendous achievement.

content:
しだい〔次第〕
〈名〉
1. (=順序)order

content.content: 次第不同
random order
次第書き
a programme
儀式の次第書
the programme of the function

content: 2. (=理由)reason

content.content: 不肖を顧みずこの重任を引受けたのはこういう次第です
That is the reason why I have taken the trust upon myself without reflecting on my want of ability.
右の次第により延引致しました
The matter has been delayed for the above reason.

content: 3. (=事情)case; circumstances

content.content: そういう次第だからお待ち願いたい
Such being the case,―Under these circumstances,―I must request you to wait.
次第によっては早速出発するかもしれぬ
I may have to start at once according to circumstances.
事ここに至りし次第を物語った
I related the circumstances that led to this state of things.
まあこういう次第です一通りお聞き下さい
This is how it happened―(古文体にては)―The manner of it was as follows:―
まあざっとそんな次第です
That is, briefly,how it happened―Those are, in sun, the facts of the case.［注意］英語に訳する必要無き場合あり、例えば
なんともお申しわけ無い次第です
I don't know how to apologize―I am so sorry.
誠に面目無い次第です
I am truly ashamed of myself.
それを聞いて一同悦んでいる次第です
We are all rejoicing at the news.
夜の灯火までも倹約している次第です
We do without a light at night.
食う物も食わずにいるような次第です
I deny myself the comforts of life.

content: 〈動詞相当〉(=何々による)to depend on (something); to hang on (something); to hinge on (something); to be conditional on (something); to rest with (some one)

content.content: そりゃ場合次第さ
That depends on circumstances.
成功は忍耐次第
Success depends on perseverance―Success is conditional on perseverance.
報酬は腕次第
Your recompense will depend on your ability.
売れ行きは品次第
The sale of the article will depend on its quality.
勝敗は必ずしも兵数次第のものではない
Victory does not always depend on numbers.
彼の命の有ると無いとは裁判官の判決次第
His life hangs on the judge's decision.
お受けするとせぬとは条件次第
My acceptance will hinge upon the terms―(他動詞構文にすれば)―I shall hinge my acceptance upon the terms.
これを決定するのは君次第だ
It rests with you to decide―The decision rests with you.

content: 〈前置詞相当〉(=に)(=何々に従って)according to (something)

content.content: 給料は腕次第に払う
You will be paid according to your ability.
場合次第に(臨機応変の)処置をせよ
Act according to circumstances.
価は品次第で違う
The price differs according to the quality―The price varies with the quality.
聖書は各自の知識次第に解釈する
Each interprets the Bible according to his or her lights.
身分次第に暮らせ
Live within your means―“Cut your coat according to your cloth.”

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 君の望み次第
anything you wish for―whatever you wish for―as much as you wish
価は望み次第
You shall have any price you may name―whatever price you may name.
褒美は望み次第
You shall have any reward you wish for.
望み次第の品がある
You will find any article to your taste―any article after your fancy.
去るもとどまるもお勝手次第
You may go or stay as you please―at your pleasure.
ご註文お好み次第
Served to order.
生徒は教師次第でどうにでもなる
The student is what you make him―wax in the hands of his teacher.
子どもは母親の育て方次第だ
A child is what its mother makes it―wax in its mother's hands.
人生は心次第(で地獄極楽)
Life is what you make it.
手当たり次第に本を読め
Read whatever you can lay your hands on!
それは人々の考え次第だ
It is a matter of opinion.
家の中は彼の言いなり次第になっている
The whole household is at his beck and call.
教員は校長の言いなり次第だ
The principal leads the teachers by the nose.
彼は細君の言いなり次第だ
He is tied to his wife's apron-strings.
あれは人の言いなり次第でどうでもなる人だ
He is wax in your hands―clay in the potter's hands.
地獄の沙汰も金次第
“Money opens all door.”

content: 〈接続詞、前置詞相当〉(=に)(=何々するや否や)as soon as; immediately on

content.content: 国からの便りの有り次第に立つ
I shall leave as soon as I hear from home.
僕は代りの有り次第に辞める
I am leaving as soon as I find a man to take my place.
当人の帰り次第に伺わせます
He shall call on you as soon as he comes home.
沙汰の有り次第に出発致します
I shall depart as soon as I have orders to do so.
御註文の有り次第に積荷可仕候
We shall ship the goods as soon as we receive your order―immediately on receipt of your order.
ご通知次第店員を差出します
We shall call on you immediately on receipt of your notice.
到着次第御伺可申候
I shall wait on you (immediately) on arrival.
品を受取り次第金を渡す
I shall hand over the money on receipt of the goods.
お申込次第規則書を送ります
The prospectus will be sent on application.
請求次第に払う
to pay on demand
思い出し次第に手紙を出しておこう
I will write to him whenever I think of it―as memory serves.

content: 〈形〉(=に)［注意］「次第に」の意味を形容詞(first, next, earliest)をもって表わすことあり。

content.content: 誰でも出会い次第に連れて来い
Bring the first man you meet!
機会の有り次第に話しておこう
I will speak to him on the first opportunity―as opportunity serves.
天気になり次第に立つ
I shall start on the first fine day.
便船の有り次第に出発する
I shall sail in the next steamer that sails.
ご都合次第に、ご都合のつき次第に金を返しなさい
You may pay me at your own convenience―at your earliest convenience―You may take your own time for payments.
どんな仕事でも有り次第に引受けます
I will undertake the first work that comes in my way―any work that comes in my way.
命令の下り次第に出発する用意をしておれ
Hold yourself in readiness to start at a moment's notice.

content: 〈副〉(=に)(=だんだん)gradually; by degrees; little by little; more and more

content.content: 次第に進歩する
to progress by degrees―make gradual progress
次第に温かになる
It is getting warmer by degrees―It grows warmer and warmer.
英語が次第に面白くなる
English becomes more and more interesting―I am getting more and more interested in the study of English.
英語が次第にわかってきた
I begin to understand English better.
次第に学ぶよりほかは無い
There is nothing for it but to learn little by little.
船が次第に遠くなる
The ship gradually recedes from the view.
音が次第に遠くになる
The sound becomes fainter and fainter.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 東京の場末が次第に開ける
The outskirts of Tokyo are opening up.
病人は次第に力がつく
The invalid gathers strength.
風が次第に速力を増す
The wind gathers speed.
風が次第に静まる
The wind dies away.
鐘の音が陰に響いて次第に鎮まる
The sound of the bell dies on the night air.

content:
じたい〔事態〕
〈名〉The state of things; the situation; the matter

content.content: 事態容易ならず
The matter grows serious―We must consider the gravity of the situation.

じたい〔字体〕
〈名〉The form of characters

content:
じたい〔自体〕
〈副〉In fact

content.content: 自体君の言うことが間違っている
In fact, you are wrong.

content:
じたい〔辞退〕
〈名〉Declension; non-acceptance:(=する) to decline (an offer, etc.)

content.content: せっかくですがご辞退致します
I am sorry I must decline your kind offer.

content:
じだい〔事大〕
〈名〉Submission to a stronger power; trimming; flunkeyism

content.content: 事大主義
a trimming policy
事大党
the trimmers
時の韓国政府は事大思想以外になんらの方針も無かった
The then Koran government had no policy but that of trimming.

content:
じだい〔時代〕
〈名〉［注意］英語を標準とす。
1. An age

content.content: 実力の時代となった
The age of ability has come.
二人は時代が違う
They lived in different ages.
時代精神
the spirit of the age―the genius of the age
黄金時代
the Golden Age
暗黒時代
the Dark Ages
戦国時代
the Age of Civil Wars
石器時代
the stone age

content: 2. A period; an era

content.content: 彼とは時代が違うから話が合わぬ
We belong to different periods, and can not agree.
天保時代
the Tempo period―the Tempo era
徳川時代
the Tokugawa period

content: 3. An epoch

content.content: 新時代を開く
to make an epoch
この著述は新時代を開く本だ
This is an epoch-making work.

content: 4. Times

content.content: 彼は時代の寵児だ
He is a favourite of the times.
時代の推移に連れて万事変わっていく
Things change with the change of the times.
時代に後れる
to fall behind the times
時代後れ
behind the times―out of date
時代の要求
the needs of the times―the exigencies of the times―a desideratum―a felt want
時代の要求に応じた策だ
The scheme meets the exigencies of the times.
時代の要求に応じた作だ
The work supplies a desideratum―supplies a felt want.
時代思潮
the spirit of the times―current ideas―current thoughts
時代思潮に後れる
to fall behind the current ideas
時代思潮に後れぬ
to keep abreast of the current thoughts

content: 5. Days

content.content: 先祖の時代に起こった習慣だ
The custom took its origin in the days of our fathers.
学校時代に彼を知った
I knew him in my school-days.
彼との交際は学校時代からだ
Our intercourse dates from our school-days.
得意時代
one's bright days―best days
失意時代
one's dark days―evil days

content: 6. (=古代)antiquity:(=の) antique; historical

content.content: 時代がつく
to become antique
時代のついた花瓶
an antique vase
時代物
an antique article―(演劇なら)―a historical play
時代行列
a historical pageant

content:
7. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 青年時代に
in one's youth
少年時代に
in one's boyhood
娘時代に
in one's girlhood
関孝和は Newton と時代を同じうする
Seki Kowa was contemporary with Newton.
時代錯誤
an anachronism

content:
じだい〔地代〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ちだい〔地代〕

content:
じだいおくれ〔時代後れ〕
〈形〉Behind the times

content.content: 彼の思想は時代後れだ
His ideas are behind the times.
この軍艦は少し時代後れだ
This ship is a trifle out of date.
時代後れの人
an antediluvian―an old fogey
時代後れの老爺が何を知るものか
What should an old fogey know?

じだいさくご〔時代錯誤〕
〈名〉An anachronism

じだいせいしん〔時代精神〕
〈名〉The spirit of the age; zeitgeist

content:
したいほうだい〔仕度い放題〕
〈副〉

content.content: 仕たいほうだいのわがままをする
to have everything one's own way
彼は仕たいほうだいのばかを仕尽した
He has committed every conceivable folly―left no folly uncommitted―ranged over the whole gamut of folly―run through the catalogue of follies―filled up the sum of follies.

じだいもの〔時代物〕
〈名〉An antique article:(演劇は)a historical play

content:
したう〔慕う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=恋しく思う)to love; to admire; to cherish; to long for (one); to sigh for (one); to yearn after (one); to have a regard for (one)

content.content: あの子はお慕い申しておりますからちと目をかけておやりなさい
The girl loves you. You must be kind to her.
彼の風格を慕うている者がたくさんある
Many people admire his personality.
亡き人を慕う
to cherish one's memory
死んだ夫を慕っている
She cherishes her husband's memory.
彼は友人達に慕われている
His friends have a regard for him.
赤児の慈母を慕うが如し
as a child yearns after its mother

content: 2. (=後を追う)to follow

content.content: 彼女は夫の後を慕って米国へ渡った
She followed her husband to America.
うつし世を神さりましし
He mingles with the gods on high,
大君の
Mine august Sovereign Lord;
みあと慕いて
And with intensely yearning heart
我は行くなり
I follow heavenward.

content:
したうけおい〔下請負〕
〈名〉A subcontract:(=する) to subcontract

content.content: 下請負の仕事
subcontracted work
下請負師
a subcontractor

content:
したうち〔舌打ち〕
〈名〉
1. Smacking one's lips:(=する) to smack one's lips

content.content: うまそうに舌打ちする
to smack one's lips with relish

content: 2. (=残念の舌打ち)tut:(=する) to tut

content.content: 舌打ちして残念がった
“Tut! tut!” he exclaimed with vexation.

content:
したえ〔下絵〕
〈名〉
1. (=下書きの絵)a rough sketch; a study

content.content: 下絵を書く
to make a rough sketch

content: 2. (=刺繍、彫刻などの下地、図案)a design (for embroidery); a draft (for sculpture)

content.content: 刺繍の下絵
a design for embroidery
これを下絵にして彫刻して貰いたい
I wish you to carve on this design.
下絵師
a designer

したおさえ〔舌押え〕
〈名〉A spatula

したおび〔下帯〕
〈名〉(A man's) loin-cloth; (a woman's) shift

content:
したがう〔従う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=服従する)to obey (one); to submit to (authority); to yield to (persuasion); to bow to (fate); to bend to (another's will); to give in to (one's views); to defer to (superior judgment); to abide by (one's decision); to comply with (one's wishes)

content.content: 上に従う
to submit to authority
運命に従う(しかたがないと諦める)
to bow to Fate―bend to Fate―submit to necessity―abide by the inevitable
人の心に従う(我を折る)
to bend to another's will
妻は夫に従う
The wife should bend to her husband's will.
女は家に在りては父に従い、嫁しては夫に従い、老いては子に従う
A woman should, when at home, obey her father; when married, obey her husband, and, when old, obey her son.
人の意見に従う
to bow to one's opinion―yield to one's views―give in to one's views―defer to one's superior judgment
君がそう言わるるならご意見に従わざるを得ぬ
If you say so, I must bow to your opinion―defer to your superior judgment.
人の勧めに従う
to yield to persuasion
人の意に従う
to comply with one's wishes
仲裁をお願い申した以上はご決定に従います
Since we have referred the matter to your arbitration, we shall submit to your decision―abide by your decision.
九州の諸族中にはまだ彼に従わざるものありき
The tribes of Kyushu had not all submitted to him.

content: 2. (=遵奉する)to obey (orders); to observe (the law); to act upon (a rule); to comply with (the regulations); to be subject to (the law)

content.content: 命令に従う
to obey orders
貴命に従います
I will obey you―You shall be obeyed―Your word shall be law to me.
貴命に従い早速上京可仕候
I shall come town without delay in obedience to your wishes.
子は親の命に従うべきものである
Children should obey their parents.
只命これ従う
to be at one's beck and call
彼らは長官に只命これ従うだ
They are at the beck and call of their chief.
法律に従う
to obey the laws―observe the law
我々は国法に従わねばならぬ
We must obey the laws of the land―We are subject to the laws of the land.
天地間に自然の法則に従わぬものは無い
Everything in the universe is subject to the laws of nature.
法則に従う
to observe a rule―act upon a rule comply with the regulations
ご規則に従いました
The regulations have been complied with.
ご規則に従って万事を整えました
Everything has been arranged in accordance with the regulations.
僕はこの主義に従う、この金言に従う
I act upon this principle―act upon this maxim.

content: 3. (=追従する)to follow (one's directions); to pursue (a policy); to act upon (one's advice); to conform to (custom)

content.content: 指図に従う
to follow one's directions
寸分違わずお指図に従いました
I have followed your directions to the letter.
忠告に従う
to act upon one's advice―follow one's advice―take one's advice
君はもし僕の忠告に従ったならこんなことになるのではなかったに
If you had followed my advice, this would not have happened.
医者の勧めに従って旅行に出かけます
On my doctor's advice, I am about to start on a journey.
世の習慣に従う
to conform to custom
世の習慣に従って僕も結婚ということをしてみようかと思う
I think of marrying in conformity to custom.
郷に入っては郷に従え
conform to the custom of the land―“Do at Rome as the Romans do.”
時俗に従う
to conform to the age
水は方円の器に従う
Water conforms to the vessel.
常例に従う
to follow the common usage
己が好むところに従う
to follow one's bent―go one's own way―have one's way
良心(理性)の示すところに従う
to obey the dictates of conscience―obey the dictates of reason
一定の方針に従う
to pursue a definite line of policy
時勢に従う、大勢に従う、世の風潮に従う
to follow the spirit of the times―swim with the current―go with the stream
世に従う
to live after the world
肉慾の欲する処に従う
to live after the flesh

content: 4. (=随従する)to follow (one's leader); to attend on (one's master); to accompany (a friend)

content.content: 彼は通訳官となって軍に従った
He followed the army as interpreter.
使節に従って欧米に渡った
He went to Europe and America in attendance on the envoy.
大将に従って転戦した
He took put in various battles under the general.

content: 5. (=従事する)to follow (a profession); to pursue (an occupation); to do (one's work)

content.content: 業に従う
to follow one's profession―pursue one's occupation
楽しんで事に従う
to do one's work with pleasure

content:
したがえる〔従える〕
〈他動〉
1. (=降参させる)to subdue; to subjugate; to reduce to subjection

content.content: 敵を従える
to subdue the enemy―subjugate the enemy―reduce the enemy to subjection―bring the enemy to his knees

content: 2. (=伴える)to be attended by (a servant); to be accompanied by (a friend)

content.content: 彼は部下を従えて来た
He came attended by his followers.
彼は一家を従えて渡米した
He went over to America with his family.

content:
したがき〔下書き〕
〈名〉A rough copy; a draft

content.content: 下書きをする
to make a draft
新聞記者は下書きをせずに書く
Journalists write off-hand.

content:
したがって〔随って、従って〕
〈副〉
1. (=準じて)in proportion; accordingly:(前置詞に用いれば)in proportion to; according to; in accordance with; with:(接続詞に訳せば)in proportion as; according as; as

content.content: 費用は収入に従って増加する
The expenses increase in proportion to the receipts―in proportion as the receipts increase.
晴雨計は気圧に従って昇降する
The barometer rises and falls according to the atmospheric pressure―according as the atmospheric pressure is high or low.
日本橋は場所だから家貨も随って高い
Nihonbashi is a business centre, and the rents are accordingly high.
文明が進むに従って詩が衰える
As civilization advances, poetry declines―Poetry declines with the advance of civilization.
聖書は各自の知識に従って解釈する
Each interprets the Bible accordingly to his or her lights.
室の大きさに従って声を調節する
You must modulate your voice according to the size of the room―according as the room is large or small.
長ずるに従って才能を表した
As he grew up, he showed his abilities.
年をとるに従って知慧がつく
One grows wiser as one grows older―One's wisdom grows with one's age.

随って得れば随って散ずる

水は低きに従って流る

彼は金使いが荒い、随って貧乏だ
He is extravagant, and the consequence is that he is poor―so that he is poor.

女にしつこくつきまとう男だ
He is persistent in his attentions to her.
彼はしつこく権利を主張する
He is tenacious of his rights.
君のようなしつこい勉強家にはかなわない
I am no match for such a pertinacious worker as you are.
今度のインフルエンザはしつこくてなかなか抜けない
This influenza in very obstinate, and you can not get over it easily.

content: 2. (=くどい)tedious (talk); garrulous (old man); inquisitive (questioner); importunate (suitor)

content.content: あの人の話はしつこい
His talk is tedious―He is a tedious talker.
老人はしつこい
Old men are garrulous.
あまりしつこく聞くと彼は返事もしない
He will make no reply if you are too inquisitive.
あまりしつこく頼むと彼は怒る
If you are too importunate, he will take offence.
しつこいね
Say no more!

content: 3. (=あくどい)heavy (colour or taste); gaudy (pattern); tawdry (ornament); luscious (taste); fulsome (flattery); oily, greasy, unctuous (manner or expression)

content.content: 色がしつこい
The colour is too heavy.
西洋花は色がしつこい
Foreign flowers are too gaudy in colour.
支那料理はしつこい
Chinese dishes are too heavy.
あの人のしつこいお世辞は飽きた
I am tired of his fulsome flattery.
あの人は様子がいやにしつこい
He has oily manners―greasy manners―unctuous manners.

content: 4. (=女にしつこい)amative; importunate

content.content: しつこい男だ
He is an importunate lover.
男がしつこく口説く
He is importunate in his advances.
男がいくらしつこく口説いても柳に風と受け流している
She deftly eludes his importunities.
あまりしつこくすると女に嫌われるぞ
Your importunacy will drive away your mistress.
あの人はあまりしつこいからいやになる
I am disgusted with his importunacy.

content:
しっこう〔執行〕
〈名〉Execution (of a sentence); enforcement (of a law); performance (of duty); exercise (of authority):(=する) to execute (a sentence); to enforce (a law); to perform (one's duties); to exercise (one's authority); to carry out (a plan); to carry (a play) into execution; to carry (a plan) into effect; to give effect to (one's promise); to hold (a ceremony, etc.)

content.content: 刑を執行する
to execute a sentence―carry a sentence into effect
執行令状
a writ of execution
死刑を執行する
to execute a death-sentence―execute a criminal
死刑執行
an execution
死刑執行令状
a death-warrant
死刑執行吏
the executioner―the hangman
執達吏が差し押えを執行する
A bailiff executes an attachment.
執行処分
an execution
強制執行
forcible execution
予戒令を執行する
to place one under the ban of the premonition law
彼は予戒令執行中の身だ
He is under the ban of the premonition law.
法律を執行する
to enforce a law
職務を執行する
to perform one's duties―discharge one's duties―exercise one's functions
職権を執行する
to exercise one's authority
(刑の)執行猶予をする
to suspend execution―stay execution―place the offender under probation→『しっこうゆうよ〔執行猶予〕』

しっこう〔失行〕
〈名〉Misconduct; a misdemeanour

しっこう〔疾行〕
〈名〉Speeding:(=する) to speed; to hasten; to hie

しっこう〔膝行〕
〈名〉Going on one's knees:(=する) to go on one's knees

content:
じっこう〔実効〕
〈名〉A practical result; effect

content.content: 実効を挙げる
to give results―take effect
新制度の実効が顕われるまでには多少の年数を要する
It will take some years for the new system to take effect.
実効の見えるまでこの薬をお上がりなさい
You must go on taking this medicine till it takes effect.

content:
じっこう〔実行〕
〈名〉
1. Doing, deed (as opposed to talk); practice (of a doctrine); execution (of a plan); performance (of a promise); enforcement (of a law):(=する) to do; to practise (a doctrine); to put (a doctrine) in practice; to reduce (a rule) to practice; to work (a plan); to carry out, execute (a plan); to carry (a plan) into execution; to carry (a plan) into effect; to give effect to (one's word); to perform (one's promise); to enforce (a law); to put (a law) in force; to act upon (one's principles); to act up to (one's resolution)

content.content: 道徳は実行の問題である
Morality is a matter of doing.
あの人は口ばかりで実行しない
He is all talk and no deed.
僕は不言実行主義だ
“No talk and all deed” is my motto.
不言実行
working in silence
あの人は実行があるから言うことに力がある
His deeds give point to his words.
教義を実行する
to practise a doctrine―put a doctrine in practice
節制を説く者は多いが実行する者は少ない
Many preach temperance, but few practise it.
説くのはやさしいが、いざ実行となるとわけが違う
It is easy to preach it; but when one comes to practise it, it is another thing.
良い方法には違いないが実行し難い
A good method, to be sure, but it is hard to practise―impracticable.
この方法なら実行できる
This plan will work―It is a workable plan.
規則を実行する
to reduce a rule to practice
いくら好い規則を立てても実行しなけりゃ駄目だ
The best rules are useless unless they are reduced to practice.
計画を実行する
to carry out a plan―execute a design―carry a plan into execution―carry a design into effect
僕は洋行する計画であったが実行する機会を得なかった
I was to have gone abroad, but I had no opportunity to carry my design into execution.
約束を実行する
to perform one's promise―give effect to one's word
法律を実行する
to enforce a law―put a law in force
僕は主義を実行する
I act upon my principles.
どこまでも決心を実行する
I will act up to my resolution.
実行し得べき
practicable―workable―feasible
実行すべからざる
impracticable―unworkable―infeasible

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 改正規則は一月一日より実行す
The revised regulations come into effect―take effect―on and after the 1st of January.
彼は口で教えるばかりでなく実行をもって示す
He not only teaches them by precept, but sets them an example.
実行は口訓に勝る
“Example is better than precept.”
言いながら実行する(殴るぞと言いながら殴る)
to suit the action to the word
僕は毎日主義を実行している
I live my principles.

content:
しっこうゆうよ〔執行猶予〕
〈名〉Suspension of execution; stay of execution; probation

content.content: 一年間執行猶予になった
He has been granted a stay of execution―placed under probation―allowed to go on probation―for a year.
執行猶予犯人
a probationer

しつごしょう〔失語症〕
〈名〉Loss of speech; aphasia

content:
じっこん〔昵懇〕
〈形〉Intimate; familiar

content.content: 二人はたいそう昵懇にしている
They are on intimate terms with each other―on familiar terms with each other―hand and glove with each other―as thick as thieves.
彼と昵懇になった
I have struck up an intimacy with him.
彼とどうして昵懇になったか
How came you to be so intimate with him?

じっさ〔実査〕
〈名〉Actual inspection:(=する) to inspect for oneself

content:
じっさい〔実際〕
〈名〉
1. (=実地)practice:(=の) practical

content.content: 理論と実際と並行すべきものである
Theory should go hand in hand with practice.
それは実際に行われない議論だ
It is an impracticable argument.
この方法なら実際に行われる
This is a practicable method.
彼は実際家だ
He is a practical man―a matter-of-fact man.
あの人は実際に疎い
He is unpractical.
実際問題
a practical question

content: 2. (=実状)the actual condition; the reality:(=の) real; actual

content.content: 僕は実際の惨状を見て来たのだ
I have witnessed the actual horrors.
実際に当たって見なけりゃ(困難の味がわからない)
You do not realize the difficulty unless you grapple with the reality―buckle yourself to the reality―tackle the reality.
実際生活
real life

content: 3. (=事実)a fact; the truth

content.content: 僕は実際を言うのだ
I am telling you the truth―It is a fact.
事の実際はこういう次第さ
These are the facts of the case.

content:
〈副〉
1. (=本当に)truly; really

content.content: 彼は実際偉い
He is truly great.
僕は実際そう思う
I really think so.

content: 2. (=現に)actually

content.content: 僕は実際見て来たのだ
I have actually seen it―These eyes have seen it.
僕は実際聞いたのだ
I have actually heard it―These ears have heard it.

content: 3. (=事実上)practically; virtually; in effect; to all intents and purposes

content.content: (彼は生きているとは名ばかりで)実際は死んだも同然だ
He is practically dead―virtually dead―as good as dead―all but dead―to all intents and purposes, a dead man.
彼の回答は実際謝罪も同然だ
His reply is, in effect, an apology―virtually an apology―an apology to all intents and purposes.
彼は実際の主人だ
He is the virtual master.
Cromwell は実際王であった
Cromwell was all but a king―a king in all but the name.

content: 4. (=また実際)(and) in fact; (as) indeed

content.content: 彼は学問が好きだというている、また実際できる
He says he takes kindly to his books; and in fact, he is a good scholar.
彼はその話が本当だと言っていた、また実際本当だ
He said the story was true―as, indeed, it is―and so, indeed, it is.
彼は英語はうまい、また実際あれほどよく英語を話す人を見たことが無い
He speaks English well. In fact, I never saw a better speaker.

content: 5. (=しかし実際は)(but) in point of fact; as a matter of fact

content.content: 彼は自分では貧乏だと言っているがしかし実際は当市屈指の金満家だ
He calls himself a poor man; but, in point of fact, he is one of the richest man in the town.
世間では彼を学者のように言うけれど実際は少しも学問が無い
People call him a scholar; but, in point of fact, he is no scholar at all.

content: 6. (=甚だ)very

content.content: 実際腹が立つ
I am very angry.

content:
じつざい〔実在〕
〈名〉Real existence; reality; essence; entity:(=の) real; existent:(=する) to exist; to have being

content.content: 実在論
realism
実在性
reality

content:
しっさく〔失錯〕
〈名〉A mistake; an error; a blunder; a slip; a lapse; a false step; a trip; a stumble; disgrace:(ばかな失錯)a folly:(一身上に関する失錯)an imprudence:(男女間の失速)an indiscretion:(いたずらからの失錯)a scrape:(=する) to make a mistake; to commit an error; to commit a blunder; to commit a folly; to commit an imprudence; to commit an indiscretion; to make a slip; to make a false step; to get into a scrape; to err; to stumble; to trip; to disgrace oneself

content.content: 僕はあの人を選んだのが失錯であった
I made a mistake in choosing that man.
大将が援兵を待ったのが失錯であった
The general committed an error in waiting for reinforcements.
君は商売を止めたのが失錯であった
You committed a blunder in giving up your business.
こんなものを買ってばかな失錯をした
I committed a folly in buying such trash.
彼はあんな女を貰ったのが一生の失錯だ
He has committed an imprudence in marrying such a girl.
君はその女といっしょに写真を撮ったのが失錯だった
You committed an indiscretion in being photographed with the girl.
海老を食い過ぎて失錯(不養生)をした
I have committed an indiscretion in eating too much crayfish.
君のような経験家にも似合わない失錯だ
It is a blunder unbecoming in a man of you experience.
若い時の失錯はしかたがない
A few slips in youth are unavoidable.
大失錯をやらかした
I have committed a huge blunder―committed a glaring blunder―committed a howler.
(寝小便などした子どもに向かって)失錯したね
You have disgraced yourself.
太郎さんは今日は失錯して小さくなっています
Taro has disgraced himself today, and dare not show his face.
(いたずら小僧に向かって)お前はまた失錯したね
You are in another scrape.
君はよく失錯してはうまくごまかすね
You manage to get into and out of scrapes with equal facility.

content:
しっし〔嫉視〕
〈名〉Regarding with jealousy:(=する) to regard (one) with jealousy; to keep a jealous eye on (one)

content.content: 日本は露国の満洲における挙動を嫉視した
Japan has kept a jealous eye on the Russian movements in Manchuria.

content:
しつじ〔執事〕
〈名〉A steward:(大名のは)a seneschal:(教会のは)a deacon

content.content: 伊達家執事
a steward to the Date Family

じっし〔実子〕
〈名〉One's true child

content:
じっし〔実施〕
〈名〉Enforcement; operation; effect:(=する) to enforce (a law); to put (a law) in force; to put (a system) in operation; to carry (a law) into effect

content.content: 法律が実施になる
A law comes into force―come into effect―takes effect―becomes effective―becomes operative.
この法律はいつから実施になるのか
When does this law come into force?
もう実施になっている
The law is in force―in full force―in effect―in full effect.
制度が実施になる
A system goes into operation―becomes operative.
二年制度がいつから実施になるのか
When does the two-years system go into operation?
もう実施になっている
The system is in operation―in full operation.
新条約は来年から実施になる
The new treaty becomes operative next year.
この勅令は四月から実施になる
The Imperial edict is to take effect in April next.

content:
じっし〔十指〕
〈名〉Ten fingers; all fingers; everybody

content.content: 彼が犯人なることは十目の見るところ十指の指すところである
Everybody points to him as the culprit―Everything points to his guilt.

じつじ〔実字〕
〈名〉A Chinese character denoting a material object

content:
じっしつ〔実質〕
〈名〉Substance; essence

content.content: 実質上の
substantial―essential―intrinsic
実質のある食物
substantial food
英国人は実質に富んだ物を好む
The English like substantial things.
彼は実質の無い人だ
There is no substance in him―He is a hollow man.
僕は外見より実質を取る
I prefer substance to appearance.
甲と乙とは実質上の差がある
There is an essential difference between the two.
空気や水は実質上の価値がある
Air and water have intrinsic value.

じっしつびょう〔実質病〕
〈名〉An organic disease

しっしゃ〔膝射〕
〈名〉Firing on one's knees:(=する) to fire kneeling

content:
じっしゅう〔実収〕
〈名〉An actual income; actual receipts

content.content: 彼は事業から一年十万円の実収がある
He realizes 100,000 yen from his business.

じっしゅう〔実習〕
〈名〉Practice; practical exercise:(=する) to practise
しつじゅうきょうれん

しつじゅうきょうれん〔執銃教練〕
〈名〉Rifle exercise; manual exercise

しつじゅん〔湿潤〕
〈名〉Humidity; moisture

content:
しっしょう〔失笑〕
〈名〉A burst of laughter:(=する) to burst out laughing; to burst into laughter; to break into a laugh

content.content: その光景を見て皆失笑した
Everybody burst out laughing at the sight.
さすがの判事も失笑した
The very judge could not keep his gravity.
先生妙なことを言って全級を失笑せしめる
His queer remarks upset the gravity of the whole class.

content:
じっしょう〔実証〕
〈名〉Actual proof; corroboration:(=する) to corroborate (a proof); to establish (a fact)

content.content: 証拠を実証する事実がある
I shall state some facts in corroboration of the evidence.
これは実証のある事実である
This is an established fact.
実証哲学
positive philosophy―positivism―Comtism
実証哲学者
a positivist―a Comtist

content:
じっしょう〔実正〕
〈名〉The truth; a fact

content.content: 右借用申し候処実正也
I hereby acknowledge the loan stated above.

content:
じつじょう〔実情〕
〈名〉The actual circumstances; the real state of things

content.content: 実情を知っている人は欺けない
You can not deceive a man who knows the actual circumstances.
僕に実情を打明け給え
Confide the real state of things to me!―Take me into your confidence!

じつじょう〔実状〕
〈名〉The true state; the real condition; the actual condition

content:
しっしょく〔失職〕
〈名〉→『

content:
