〈名〉→『

content.content: しつぎょうしゃ〔失業者〕

content:
しっしん〔失神〕
〈名〉
1. (=気ぬけ) absent-mindedness; abstraction; stupefaction:(=する) to be absent-minded; to be abstracted; to be stupefied

content.content: 彼は失神したように眺めている
He stares with an absent-minded air―with an abstracted air―abstractedly.
悲しみの余り失神している
He is stupefied with grief.
細君に死なれて失神している
He is stupefied with grief over his wife's death―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His wife's death has cut him up dreadfully.

content:
2. (=気絶)fainting; a swoon:(=する) to faint; to swoon; to fall into a swoon; to fall unconscious; to fall insensible; to fall senseless; to lose one's consciousness
3. (=気の狂うこと)madness; insanity; lunacy:(=する) to go mad; to go crazy; to become insane; to be bereft of reason; to lose one's wits

じっしんほう〔十進法〕
〈名〉The decimal system

content:
じっすう〔実数〕
〈名〉The actual number

content.content: 兵の実数
the effective strength of an army

content:
しっする〔失する〕
〈他動〉(=失う)to lose; to miss

content.content: 機を失する
to miss an opportunity―lose a chance
火を失する
to cause a fire (though carelessness)
面目を失する
to disgrace yourself

content: 〈自動〉(=誤る)to err

content.content: 厳に失する、寛に失する
to err on the side of severity―err on the side of lenity
人もし誤り無きを保し難しとせば寛に失するに如かず
If man must err, it is best to err on the side of lenity.
君は乱暴に失する
You err on the side of violence―You are too violent.

content:
しっせい〔叱正〕
〈名〉Correction:(=する) to correct

content.content: ご叱正を乞う
I beg you will correct my composition―look over my composition.

しっせい〔叱声〕

content.content: 叱声を発して弁士を引込ませる
to hiss down the speaker

content:
しっせい〔執政〕
〈名〉Administration; government:(=する) to administer the affairs of state; to govern (the country)

content.content: 国王は統治すれども執政せず
The king rules, but does not govern.
(国家危急存亡の時の)臨時執政官
a dictator

content:
しっせい〔失政〕
〈名〉Misgovernment; misrule; maladministration

content.content: 失政のため国は衰えるばかり
The country goes on declining owing to misgovernment―under misrule.

content:
じっせいかつ〔実生活〕
〈名〉Real life

content.content: 学校で学ぶことで実生活に役に立つことは少ない
The greater part of school-learning is useless in life.

content:
しっせき〔叱責〕
〈名〉Reproof; reprimand; rebuke:(=する) to reprove, reprimand, rebuke (one for a fault); to take (one) to task; to bring (one) to book; to call (one) to account

content.content: 学業を怠って叱責を受けた
I was reproved for neglecting my studies.
命に背いたから叱責してやった
I took him to task for disobeying orders.

しっせき〔失跡〕
〈名〉Disappearance:(=する) to disappear; to vanish

じっせき〔実積〕
〈名〉Solid measure; capacity

content:
じっせき〔実績〕
〈名〉Actual results

content.content: 実績を挙げる
to give actual results
事業の実績が挙がらぬ
The work has not given good results―not borne fruit.

content:
じっせき〔実跡〕
〈名〉Actual traces; evidences

content.content: 室内を見ると逃亡の実跡は明らかだ
The evidence of flight are clear―The room shows clear evidences of flight.

content:
じっせけん〔実世間〕
〈名〉The actual world

content.content: 彼は実世間に疎い
He is out of touch with the world.

content:
じっせつ〔実説〕
〈名〉A true account; an authentic history

content.content: 実説には児島高徳は無い人らしい
According to true history, Kojima Takanori seems to be a myth.

content:
じっせん〔実戦〕
〈名〉Actual warfare; action; battle

content.content: 実戦に臨む
to be in action―under fire
兵は実戦に臨んであたかも演習におけるが如く冷静沈着に働いた
The men behaved under fire as coolly and steadily as if they were on parade.
大将は幾度も実戦に臨んでいる
He has been in a hundred battles.
日本の海軍は実戦に臨んでいる
The Japanese navy has been in action.
日本の海軍は実戦の試験に及第している
The Japanese navy has stood the test of actual warfare.

content:
じっせん〔実践〕
〈名〉Practice:(=の) practical:(=する) to practise; to put (a doctrine) in practice; to act up to (one's principles); to live up to (one's faith)

content.content: 僕は主義を実践する決心だ
I will act up to my principles.
実践躬行する
to act up to one's principles―live up to one's faith
道徳の本旨は実践躬行にあり
The object of morality is actual practice.
実践躬行の人
a man of deed
実践道徳
practical morality
実践哲学
practical philosophy

content:
しっそ〔質素〕
〈形〉
1. (=飾らず奢らぬ)simple (fare); plain (dress); modest (life); unpretending, unpretentious (house); unostentatious (manner, etc.)

content.content: 彼は質素な身形{みなり}をしている
He is plainly dressed.
質素な食物を食っている
He lives on plain food―simple fare.
質素な家に住んでいる
He lives in an unpretending house―an unpretentious house.
質素な生活をしている
He leads a modest life―an unpretending existence.
万事質素にしている
He is simple and unostentatious in everything.

content: 2. (=倹約)frugal

content.content: 彼は質素に暮らしている
He lives frugally―lives on sixpence a day―lives in a small way.
軍人は質素を旨とすべし

〈名〉Failure; miscarriage; ill success; defeat; frustration; reverses; a fiasco; a miss:(=する) to fail (in something―with some one); to make a failure of it; to miscarry; to be defeated, be frustrated, be baffled, be foiled, be baulked (in one's design); to meet with a reverse; to suffer a reverse; to come to grief

content.content: 試みが失敗した
My attempt has failed with me―I have failed in my attempt―My attempt has miscarried.
彼は試験で失敗した
He has failed in the examination.
またまんまと失敗した
He has managed to fail again.
人が失敗することに彼だけが成功する

He has failed in his business―His business has failed with him.
商売上の失敗
failure in business―business reverses
商売上の失敗から起こった悲劇だ
Business reverses brought on the tragedy.
彼は手を出すごとに失敗した
He failed at every turn―He was driven from pillar to post.
彼はきっと失敗するぞ
He is sure to fail―He is certain to make a failure of it.
気をつけないと失敗するぞ
Be careful, or you will come to grief.
彼は一度の失敗くらいに屈する人ではない
He is not the man to be daunted by a single failure.
僕は一度の失敗くらいは平気だ
I am none the worse for a single failure.
失敗はかえって薬だ
You are all the better for your failure.
彼は失敗してどうだ弱っているか
How does he take his failure?
失敗して気にしているか
Does he take his failure seriously?
失敗しても呑気なもんだ
He takes his failure quite easy.
失敗は成功の基
Failure is the way to success.
失敗を転じて成功にする
to turn failure into success―win victory from defeat
今度失敗すりゃ破滅だ
Failure means ruin―Failure spells ruin.
失敗に帰す
to end in a failure―result in a failure―issue in a failure―eventuate in a failure―be doomed to failure―prove a failure―prove abortive―end in smoke
事業は失敗に帰した
The enterprise ended in a failure.
企ては失敗に帰した
The scheme ended in smoke.
試みが失敗に帰した
The attempt proved abortive.
そのような遠征は失敗にきまっている
Such an expedition is doomed to failure.
大失敗
a signal failure―a dead failure―a complete failure―a fiasco
計画は大失敗に帰した
The project ended in a fiasco.
計画は全然失敗に帰した
The whole scheme has ended in a complete failure―gone to the ground―fallen through―The whole scheme is dashed to earth.
敵の計略は失敗に帰した
The enemy were baffled in their design―baulked in their design―defeated in their design―foiled in their design―frustrated in their design.
敵の計略を失敗に帰せしむ
to baffle―baulk―defeat―foil―frustrate―the enemy's design
事失敗に帰した暁には死あるのみだ

失敗するといけないから予備にするものが必要だ
We must have something to fall back upon lest we should fail―in case we should fail―in case of failure.
失敗の憂い無きように念に念を押せ

彼は幾度失敗しても懲り性がない
He does not profit by experience―does not learn by experience.
今度の学校は失敗だ

彼は失敗者だ

一人の成功者の蔭には幾多の失敗者が潜んでいる(成功する者が一人あれば失敗する者が幾千人ある)

content.content: 先生質問してよろしいか
Sir, may I ask you a question?―trouble you with a question?
うるさく質問する
to trouble one with questions―ply one with questions―plague one with questions―pester one with questions
君に質問したいことがある
I have something to ask you―I wish to ask you something.
わからないところは質問なさい

何か質問がありませんか

ほかに質問はありませんか

彼のことだからきっとこの事業を仕遂げる
He is sure to go through the undertaking―bring the project to a successful issue.
彼は大事を仕遂げた
He has achieved a great deed.
彼は立派に改革を仕遂げた
He has effected the reform to admiration―succeeded in effecting the reform.
彼は思った事は必ず仕遂げる
He never fails to carry through―put through―what he has set his heart on doing.

content:
シトシト
〈形〉Damp; moist

content.content: 着物が露でシトシトになった
My clothes are moist with dew.

content: 〈副〉Softly; gently; in earnest

content.content: 雨がシトシト降っている
It is raining in earnest.

content:
しとね〔褥〕
〈名〉A cushion; a mattress

content.content: 子どもは母の膝を褥に寝ている
The child sleeps in its mother's lap.

しとみ〔蔀〕
〈名〉A kind of shutter

content:
しとめる〔仕留める〕
〈他動〉To kill; to shoot dead; to bring down (a bird)

content.content: 一発で美事に仕とめた
He fairly killed it at a shot.

content:
しとやか
〈形〉Graceful; gentle; refined; and easy in manner

content.content: 日本の婦人は動作がしとやかだ
The Japanese lady has a graceful deportment―Japanese ladies are graceful in their deportment.

じどり〔地取り〕
〈名〉A ground-plan:(=する) to lay out (a town, a garden, etc.)

しとる〔湿る〕
〈名〉To be moist; to be damp

content:
しどろに
〈副〉In confusion; in disorder; pell-mell

content.content: 船が急に揺れると卓上の皿や小鉢がしどろに転げ落ちるのであった
The ship would give a lurch, and the plates and dishes roll pell-mell off the table.
髪をしどろに乱して走って来た
She came running with dishevelled hair.

content:
しどろもどろ
〈形、副〉Confused; disordered

content.content: しどろもどろになる
to be thrown into confusion―thrown into disorder
質問の矢に攻められて返答もしどろもどろであった
On being plied with questions, he gave confused answers.
言葉もしどろもどろ
He became confused in his speech.
しどろもどろに置いた模様
sprawling design
